programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (33/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy finds two identical vases that are actually communicating vessels in a Native American Indian chest. If he sticks his hand in one, it comes out the other, between them. This should satisfy Grizzy's natural lazy streak, regardless of the distance unless the Lemmings realize the incredible games they could play with the magic vases.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (34/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy finds a vintage stopwatch in the garage which lets you wind back the minute that has just passed by and it can even stop time and movement in one's surroundings. This will give him a sure advantage over the Lemmings, provided of course they don't get their hands on it.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (35/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy is disturbed in the middle of his TV snack by a strange flow of incongruous objects that have been transformed into hot-air balloons. When he sees the Lemmings onboard these curious zeppelins, Grizzy understands that he will quickly have to confiscate their helium tank and balloons if he wants to relax in front of the TV.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (64/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy happens onto an old American India medallion bearing the symbol of the wind. He who wears it has the power to command air streams. Grizzy would be quite content to never leave the sofa again and control things from a distance, but the Lemmings want it to create fantastic new games that literally blow you away.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (36/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers with great delight that the ranger has purchased a brand new multifunction Stressless recliner. But even an armchair designed for well-being - the ultimate in relaxation - can used for other purposes by the Lemmings, who transform it into a fearsome multi-game chair.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (7/78)
programme.desc: Mike's worst nightmare comes true when Louise digs out her old toy Chikie from her trunk. Chikie is a horrifying squeaky toy that used to haunt Mike's dreams when he was a pup. Mike can't bear to be anywhere near it and the raccoons discover the perfect solution to keep Mike out of their way. Mike's going to have to use his other senses if he has any chance of overcoming hsi fear and defeating the raccoons.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (8/78)
programme.desc: Mike's yoga session is rudely interrupted when Fluffy comes to annoy him. Mike pushes him away and Fluffy ends up landing in a bag of charcoal. When Fluffy steps out he looks just like a baby racoon! His disguise is so good that Freddy and Mercury are both convinced he's an aspiring thief just like them. Now Mike is forced to face not just two masked thieves... but three.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (9/78)
programme.desc: The turtles are struck by lightning during a storm, turning them into positively charged projectiles zapping everything they touch and setting off all the appliances in the house. Mike gets locked outside by the raccoons who were freezing their little butts off in their lair. By the time Mike gets back inside all hell has broken loose, but Mike might have figured out how he can get rid of the raccoons and de-electrify the turtles at the same time.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (10/78)
programme.desc: Playing with Louise and her doll gives Mike an idea. He decides to stage a rescue mission with the doll from the roof of the Mikkelson's house so he can be a hero and impress Iris. But as he prepares to show Iris that he's a real-life superhero, the racoons arrive and ruin his plans. Mercury falls in love with the doll the minute he lays eyes on it while Freddy sets his sights on her sparkly tiara. Now Mike has a real rescue on his hands, all under Iris's watchful gaze. The stakes couldn't be higher!

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (11/78)
programme.desc: The racoons watch Mike enviously as he makes himself comfortable in his living room. If only they could get a piece of that sweet action. Then Freddy has an idea. He crashes into the bay window and pretends to be injured, forcing the Mikkelsens to take him in. Mike sees through the ruse immediately, but if he's going to unmask the scheming raccoon he's going to have to defeat the imposter without getting himself in trouble for fighting the poor "injured" Freddy.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (12/78)
programme.desc: Laura leaves her cell phone at home and Mike discovers a hilarious video of Fluffy on it that he absolutely has to show Iris. But the raccoons want to get their hands on the phone too and during an insane chase Fluffy scoops it up in her mouth and accidentally swallows it. Fluffy dashes around the house to escape the racoons and every time she gets bumped it sets off a new app. Will Mike ever get the phone back?

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (13/78)
programme.desc: Wanting to impress Iris, Mike slips his bowtie on and does his best James Bond impression. What a stud! Meanwhile the turtles are using Stephan's harpoon to go zip-lining and the raccoons see the perfect chance to break in and get their loot out discreetly. Now Mike has an opportunity to act like a real secret agent. can he live up to it?

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (25/63)
programme.desc: Lola helps Hugo learn how to ride a scooter. But the Guanos, drawn to the horn in the shape of a pigeon, and that they think is real, try to sabotage Lola. Pat to the rescue!

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (26/63)
programme.desc: Lola is going to be interviewed following a class presentation she did on recycling. While she is getting ready for it, the Guanos start pelting Hoodie and Pat with garbage. Pat is going to have to get the Guanos under control while cleaning up the mess before the reporter arrives.

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (27/63)
programme.desc: Marcus and Squizel have stolen a ticket for the Justin Justin concert from a little girl in order to scalp it. Pat discreetly helps Lola get it back and return it to its rightful owner.

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (28/63)
programme.desc: The friendly letter from Lucie addressed to Lola gets carried away in the wind. Pat will bend over backwards to get it back and make sure that the Guanos, who are drawn to the “sticker” glued on it, don’t get it first.

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (29/63)
programme.desc: Lola has to recover her mother’s brooch that she hung around Hoodie’s neck, because Hoodie has disappeared. He has been recruited by the Dobermanns who are convinced that he is part of the police force like them. Pat has to rescue Hoodie and the brooch.

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (30/63)
programme.desc: Lola is fed up with her mother always being glued to her smartphone. With help from Pat, she hides it...but the Guanos find it. Pat has to quickly get the cell phone back because mommy is expecting a very important call.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (25/52)
programme.desc: Alice loathes injustice and never hesitates to call someone out on it. But while defending the Cards against the Queen, she finds out that standing up to the powers that be can sometimes have negative consequences: she’s now banished from Wonderland!! In an effort to get Her Majesty to cancel her punishment and change the way she treats her subjects, Alice teaches Lewis and the Cards a method of fighting back that is completely foreign to the Wonderlanders: going on strike! Sometimes, safety in numbers really is the way to go!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (26/52)
programme.desc: It’s Painting Day today and everyone is to make a picture of the Queen! Delighted at being a part of it, Alice grabs some art materials from the Twins’ caravan. Except, she picks up absorbent paint by mistake, and, a few brush strokes later, the Queen winds up imprisoned inside Alice’s canvas! Alice feels so bad, so she and her friends do everything in their power to find a way to get Queeny out of there, before she gets stuck inside the picture for eternity!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (27/52)
programme.desc: As soon as she sets foot in Wonderland, this particular day, Alice causes an accident, sending the Twins’ caravan rolling right into the Queen’s teatime table! Her Majesty is so upset, she banishes the caravan from the kingdom forever!... Unless Alice & Lewis can prove to her that the vehicle is faster than her SquealMobile! And so begins a crazy race wherein Alice goes all out to make that caravan a winning racer!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (43/52)
programme.desc: Alice turns up in Wonderland with a plastic toy magic wand. So imagine her surprise when she finds out that, in this parallel location, it actually works like a real-life magic wand! Lewis is circumspect. He warns her: magic can be dangerous when you don’t know what you’re doing! Alice promises she’ll be careful – she’ll only use it to help people. But before long, our little friend realizes Lewis was right, especially when Charlie snags her wand and runs off with it, using it randomly! Alice must find a way to clean up her mistakes and those of Charlie, and get everything back the way it was.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (28/52)
programme.desc: Alice has bought herself a gorgeous new cap but gets laughed at when she wears it to school. Seriously embarrassed, she escapes to Wonderland. Today just happens to be “Hide & Seek Day” in the kingdom – a game that has all the subjects quaking with fear. And for good reason: whoever remains unfound will vanish forever! Of course, Alice is unaware of this rule and hides so well that she doesn’t get spotted. She subsequently starts becoming more and more transparent, finally turning invisible! Her friends MUST find a way to make her visible again!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (14/78)
programme.desc: After studying a magazine advertisement with a couple standing in front of an SUV, Grizzy imagines that if only he had a nice car, his favorite she-bear would be interested in him. He decides to confiscate the Lemmings crate on wheels and give it a serious overhaul. The Lemmings have nothing against an upgrade, as long as they remain behind the wheel!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (4/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings discover a strange pond in an American Indian grotto that has the power to rejuvenate anyone who dips in it. They spray a bit of the water of youth onto Grizzy and he instantly turns into a harmless cub they can easily rid themselves of. But the effects of the waters are only temporary.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (15/78)
programme.desc: While chasing the Lemmings, who stole his jar of chocolate spread, Grizzy crashes into an arcade cabinet near the supermarket which displays a model fortune teller and her crystal ball. Grizzy realizes that he can foresee events that are going to happen to him in the crystal ball, and namely the traps that the Lemmings have planned for him.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (17/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings have turned the entire cabin topsy-turvy to organize medieval jousts with the ranger's fencing gear. Grizzy, who wishes to recover his couch, tries to straighten up, but is driven out by their fencing foils. To retaliate, Grizzy must find a blade equal to the task. He opts for a fine... frozen swordfish!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (7/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy finds a phial containing a love potion: anyone who drinks it immediately falls in love with the first creature he sees. Grizzy already imagines himself becoming irresistible in the eyes of his beloved she-bear. But that is without taking into account the Lemmings... clumsiness, and their rodeo caribou drinking the magic potion.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (5/78)
programme.desc: Before taking a nap, Grizzy locks the food cupboard to prevent the Lemmings from getting into it. And to be sure they cannot force the lock, Grizzy throws all the house tools into the ravine. The Lemmings find a crate of mini building-blocks which enables them to build a hammer... and any other object they wish!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (50/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings have got their hands on a pack of white beans which have very strange properties: when mixed with soda, anyone who eats them turns into a bouncing ball. Grizzy realizes that if he wants to take a nap, he must first get rid of the magic beans.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (6/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings happen on a native American Indian burial place under the ranger's cabin. When they accidentally activate a magic disk representing the earth, they are sent back in time to the prehistoric era...

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (73/78)
programme.desc: The raccoons resort to kidnapping Iris in order to create a diversion so Freddy can rob the Mikkelsens house. Back in the lair, Mercury is left in charge of watching Iris who turns out to be more than a match for the bumbling raccoon. Mike isn't going to let Freddy get away with his robbery either.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (74/78)
programme.desc: Mike rescues Fluffy from the raccoon's lair but he doesn't notice that the kitty has pocketed one the racoon's favourite toys. Fluffy and the turtles are in love with their new musical toy! The indignant raccoons turn up at the Mikkelsens looking for a way to get it back. How dare someone steal their stuff! But they didn't count on how hard Fluffy and the turtles will fight to keep their new favourite toy out of the racoon's hands.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (75/78)
programme.desc: Mike is forced into action when the raccoons steal the turtles to help Freddy hold up his newly made throne. The crazy raccoon envisions himself a king and thinks the turtles are the perfect finishing touch to his scheme. Mike sneaks into the raccoons lair to steal back his friends. With Iris's help, he intends to teach the raccoons a lesson they won't forget.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (76/78)
programme.desc: Poor Mike is bedridden. He's been struck down by a nasty cold so Iris and the turtles are forced take care of his every need, including trying to repel the raccoons from the house. Fighting raccoons isn't their specialty and Iris and the turtles quickly end up locked in the garage. Mike is forced to intervene but he's so sick and weak that he's a pushover. How can he overcome the raccoons this time? Mike's problem could be the very solution he needs to defeat the tenacious raccoons.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (77/78)
programme.desc: Mike is forced to spend the day outside in his doghouse due to Grandma Mikkelsen's fur allergy. Mike makes the best of being exiled and plans to spruce the place up and invite Iris over for an outdoor picnic. But Mercury has been kicked out of his lair after a fight with his brother and decides to squat in the doghouse. Mike does everything he can to wake up the snoozing raccoon and get him out of his home. It looks like he's going to have to bring in the big guns if has any chance of evicting his unwanted guest before Iris shows up.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (78/78)
programme.desc: The Mikkelsen's house has been cleaned and the floor has been polished to a deep sheen. Mike has been told to keep his paws off it. Unfortunately, the filthy raccoons sneak in to steal from the house and wreak havoc. Mercury is loving it, taking advantage of the shiny new floor to practice his ice skating. Mike is determined to get the raccoons out of the house without setting a single paw on the floor.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (1/78)
programme.desc: Mike's wants to impress Iris by preparing some yummy tacos, but Fluffy and the Turtles are making his life difficult by using the extractor fan as a makeshift skydiving game. Things take a turn for the worse when the raccoons break in and try to steal the TV. Mike needs to be in two places at once if he has any chance of rescuing Fluffy and stop the Racoons from stealing the TV and ruining his romantic dinner.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (45/78)
programme.desc: When Tom goes through reverse evolution and is transformed into a swamp monster, he uses it to his advantage, scaring creatures that frightened him earlier. Soon he sees Van Mouseling in the woods and can't resist chasing him all over.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (78/78)
programme.desc: Tom blows on a trumpet to dislodge Jerry from his hiding place, which leads to Frankie the rat convincing Tom he's a great trumpeter. Frankie plays manager, Jerry joins in as percussionist, and they audition neighborhood animals for a third member of their jazz trio. Unfortunately, when Spike is chosen on the upright double bass, rivalries spark up and nerves threaten the trio's success.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (51/78)
programme.desc: Butch gets muscled out of his alley by a bullying runt of an alley cat and Tom, Jerry and Spike team up to help Butch win back his territory (and keep him out of theirs).

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (53/78)
programme.desc: A magician's hat is left behind at Ginger and Rick's house. Jerry runs into it, but when Tom reaches in after him, all he gets are multiple magician props. Tyke and Spike soon join in, and the top hat continues to wreak havoc.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (47/78)
programme.desc: Skullie warns Tom that it's almost midnight, so he'd best be on alert for one of the Catsylvania ghouls to show up. Tom reaches for a towel to wipe the soap out of his eyes but is shocked to discover that he's not using a towel at all, but a Mummy-cat's wrap! Soon, the Mummy-cat finds ways to freak out Tom and befuddle him, Jerry and Tuffy all over the house.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (49/78)
programme.desc: When Tom and Butch both arrive to ask out Toodles, their competitive behavior prompts her to send them away to a charm school she recently attended. But how will they fare in the grueling etiquette courses taught by elegant cat instructors?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (52/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings inherit a crate that fell off a Canadian army convoy transporting ultra-secret material. The case inside the crate emits a sort of laser beam that divides objects into multiple miniaturized versions of themselves. What if the Lemmings had to deal with lots of mini-Grizzys rather than just one big one?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (53/78)
programme.desc: Near the supermarket, a machine hands out surprise eggs in exchange for a coin. Amongst the lots to be won, there is a super firework rocket that makes the Lemmings dream, and a piece of costume jewelry that Grizzy imagines himself giving to his lady-love.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (54/78)
programme.desc: At the Ranger's home, Grizzy finds a high-tech gadget that enables you to learn anything at all sewing, origami, Kung Fu, etc... within only seconds thank to electrodes hooked to the brain. He can now become the perfect bear! But first, he first needs a program to learn how to get rid of the Lemmings.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (55/78)
programme.desc: An old metal box found by chance in a recess of a cliff brings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (56/78)
programme.desc: How can one peacefully watch a documentary on salmon fish, nice and comfy on the sofa, when the Lemmings are playing chemistry novices with a fun experiment box? By confiscating their equipment? Beware of side effects.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (57/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy's TV remote control is stolen by a partridge who collects high-tech objects in his nest perched high up in a tree. This is a case of absolute urgency! Grizzy has no other choice but to requisition the Lemmings propulsion game to recover his possession. But try and make a Lemming understand that!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (16/78)
programme.desc: A newly unpacked UV tanning booth holds the place of honor in the middle of the cabin. Grizzy gets it into his head that a classy tan will help him draw the attention of the she-bear he's enamored with. When he opens the box, he discovers that the Lemmings have beat him to it and are already playing "beach party" inside the bed.

programme.title: Moley - Season 1 (11/52)
programme.desc: Moley vows to not eat worms for a few days in support of Dotty’s veganism and his worm craving temptations get out of control.

programme.title: Moley - Season 1 (12/52)
programme.desc: When Moley spends the day with a young mole named Cheese who wants to be just like him, Moley helps Cheese recognize his own talents and uniqueness.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (41/52)
programme.desc: While the trains are setting up for the Vicarstown Fall Festival, Thomas is feeling down about the end of summer and the changing whether. Now it'll be up to his friends to figure out which autmunal activity will get Thomas into the spirit of Fall, but not before they run into a few fall-themed obstacles.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (42/52)
programme.desc: When Percy has to deliver the mail – even though it’s Halloween and everyone knows the Ghost Train rolls today, Thomas comes along to help him face his fears. But when a “real” Ghost Train appears to be following them, things get almost...spooky.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (43/52)
programme.desc: After Thomas throws away Diesel’s favorite oil can thinking it’s trash, he makes a promise to Diesel that he'll get it back, but it'll take an intense search around Sodor for Thomas to learn that one train's trash can be another's greatest treasure.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (44/52)
programme.desc: While playing a hide and seek game, Diesel accidentally gets stuck on a barge, which floats out to sea. Many friendly faces offer Diesel help to get back to the island, but his stubborn pride gets in the way. Will Diesel admit his mistake and ask for help or never see Sodor again?

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (45/52)
programme.desc: When Thomas and Diesel have to take the Troublesome Trucks on an important delivery, they end up turning it into a fun competition, however, the Troublesome Trucks have some fun of their own, goading the friends into making worse and worse choices. Eventually, Diesel breaks his wheel, and the engines have to figure out a creative and SAFE way to complete their delivery.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (46/52)
programme.desc: Percy announces he’s giving up his Ghost Scaring Machine - - he's too old for it now. However, when the Biggest Adventure Club has another adventure to explore, it soon becomes clear that the machine is good for more than just "scaring ghosts."

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (47/52)
programme.desc: Thomas is elated when he finds a cowbell on the side of the tracks, but when Percy asks to borrow it for a moment and allows Nia to use it without Thomas's permission, the friends end up needing to go on a wild goose chase just to get the bell back. Everyone may end up learning an important lesson about borrowing.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (48/52)
programme.desc: When Sir Topham Hatt’s hat blows away in the wind, Thomas and his friends race around Sodor, trying to catch it. Each train seems to have a different idea of how to get the hat back, but it remains out of reach until the friends learn to work together.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (1/52)
programme.desc: After accidentally derailing Gordon, Thomas promises to deliver Gordon's cargo to Whiff's Recycling Plant while racing with Diesel to get there first! As the competition gets heated and cargo is dropped, friends help Thomas pick up the pieces and remember that keeping the promise to Gordon is what will make Thomas the number one engine.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (49/52)
programme.desc: Nia is planning a big party to celebrate the anniversary of her arrival on Sodor. But when she tries to think of where to hold her party, she finds that her friends are too busy to talk about it or even attend the party itself. Nia is very let down... but she’s in for a big surprise.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (50/52)
programme.desc: When Harold the Helicopter's rotor stops working, he needs a ride across Sodor to get a quick fix. That's when Thomas comes to the rescue. During their ride, Thomas asks Harold all sorts of questions about what it's like to fly, but Harold is much more interested in Thomas's point of view from the ground. Before their journey is over, Thomas might be reminded about the best parts of being an engine.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (42/52)
programme.desc: Mr. Bean cannot, for the life of him, place the face of the uninvited fat bloke on his doorstep. An old school photograph and school cap just about jog his memory. By this time his new ‘friend’ has put his feet up and is eating Bean out of house and home. This blast from the past proves to be a blasted pain in the neck.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (43/52)
programme.desc: Irma Gobb comes round to watch TV and Bean finds that liking different programmes to your girlfriend can be very bad for a relationship. After an explosive argument the TV blows up, forcing Mr. Bean to invent his own very ingenious form of home entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (44/52)
programme.desc: Determined to master Beethoven’s symphony, Mr Bean wangles himself a grand piano, a music book, a candelabra and a very patient piano teacher. Liberace, eat your heart out!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (45/52)
programme.desc: It's the start of a Fun Run. Mr. Bean lines-up beside his deadly enemy: the fat bloke who stole his parking space. Fun Run or no, nothing will stop Bean beating this man to the finishing post, even if he has to flag a cab.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (46/52)
programme.desc: Mr. Bean gets in a flap when a monster turns up in his cake-mix. The good news, though, is that the monster turns out to be a harmless baby bird. The bad news is that it grows into a huge stork and takes over his home. Bean attempts to return it to the wild, and finds teaching it to fly makes his arms ache.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (47/52)
programme.desc: When the frogspawn in Mr. Bean’s bath hatch out, it’s the last thing his landlady needs, especially when she’s invited the Mayor for tea. Hundreds of angry amphibians decide to invite themselves as well. Bean proves to be no expert at catching slippery green things that won’t stop hopping about all over the blinking place.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (48/52)
programme.desc: Mr. Bean meets an aristocratic old lady when he nearly runs over her lapdog with his mini. He’s thrilled to be invited for luncheon at her grand but strangely shabby mansion. Bean is determined to rise to the occasion. He’s so busy with matters of protocol he doesn’t notice that the lady and her sinister butler aren’t quite what they seem…

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (49/52)
programme.desc: How does one choose tasteful wallpaper these days? After watching a royal documentary on TV, Mr. Bean decides to decorate his room in the style of Buckingham Palace. If the Queen’s new wallpaper is good enough for Her Royal Highness, then it’s going to be good enough for him. Meanwhile, his landlady, Mrs. Wicket, suffers from illusions of grandeur and crowns herself Queen of the street.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (50/52)
programme.desc: Mr. Bean finds himself in a race to grow a giant marrow with his next-door neighbour. There’s prize money at stake and a chance to get his photo in the papers. And so, as the competition gets tough, Bean’s gardening techniques become more ingenious, unconventional and desperate.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (51/52)
programme.desc: He’s got her record, the poster and the T-shirt, so when Mr. Bean’s heart-throb, Roxy, is set to sing in concert at the London Palladium, he sets his sights on the only thing that will make his life complete: her signature in his autograph book. A difficult feat but can love prevail?

programme.title: Lamput - Season 3 (14/43)
programme.desc: Fugitive Lamput ends up in a seedy dive by the waterfront. It happens when you’re on the run. These thugs sure know how to have fun, though; people come from far and wide to be creamed at arm wrestling by gigantic Mr Moustache. It’s a jumpin’ scene - until those two dorks from the Lab walk in, and start kicking up a stink about the new extremely orange trophy that’s up for grabs. The Boss (apparently an old bikie at heart) is more than up for the arm wrestling challenge. It’s the bicep-off of the decade, with Lamput as the prize.

programme.title: Moley - Season 1 (13/52)
programme.desc: Mishmosh builds a tunnel digger, upsetting some that it will replace moles’ need to dig themselves. Dotty accidently gets locked in the machine and it gets activated!

programme.title: Moley - Season 1 (14/52)
programme.desc: When Buttercup (the Queen’s dog) digs his way down into Moletown, he forms a bond with the Gardener.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (52/52)
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is over the moon when he meets Mr. Pod because both men have so much in common; same shirt, jacket, trousers and underpants. And to top it all, Pod is Bean’s spitting image! Bean falls to Earth with a bump, though, when his girlfriend, Irma Gobb, finds Mr. Pod much better looking than him.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 2 (1/52)
programme.desc: Mr Bean is unimpressed with a horror movie he sees at the cinema and reckons he can do much better. Bean sets out to create his very own home movie masterpiece –featuring Mrs Wicket Irma and Teddy! The screening in the garden is a huge success but will Mrs Wicket be pleased with her makeover and starring role?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 2 (2/52)
programme.desc: Mr Bean has to look after Mrs Wicket’s pet goldfish while she is away. With a ravenous Scrapper sniffing around Bean ends up becoming more bodyguard than babysitter. But when he manages to lose his fishy friend Mr Bean takes a nightmare journey down the sewer and back to his neighbour’s house via the park. Can Mr Bean get the pesky pet back in the bowl before Mrs Wicket returns home?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 2 (3/52)
programme.desc: Mr Bean wins two tickets for an exotic cruise and naturally he takes Teddy along for the trip of a lifetime. Once aboard the huge ocean liner Mr Bean soon settles into a life of luxury but while showing off to a new friend Bean becomes ‘man overboard’ and stranded on a dessert island. The hungrier he gets the wilder he becomes and desperate to find a way off the island.

programme.title: Lamput - Season 3 (4/43)
programme.desc: Lamput faints of thirst on a desert highway, so already it’s not a great day for the little orange shape-shifter. Add to that the fact that Specs and Skinny just happen by in a lockup van, and things go south pretty promptly. Specs and Skinny learn a valuable lesson: maybe if you’re going to anger a morphing super-blob by throwing them in the back of a van and withholding precious water, you shouldn’t do it whilst driving by a 100 foot cliff drop down to the open ocean. Hopefully these Docs are better swimmers than your average academic.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 4 (75/78)
programme.desc: Spike's bones are missing, and Frankie the Rat is the culprit. Now all they have to do is catch in the dirty rat in the act.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 4 (76/78)
programme.desc: Things get crazy down on the farm when a cat and mouse pursuit lead Jerry to hide his turtle egg in a hen's nest.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 4 (77/78)
programme.desc: The Cat and Mouse are hired to find out who absconded with Hoops McJumpalot's lucky hightop sneakers.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 4 (78/78)
programme.desc: Tom and Spike get glued together.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (1/39)
programme.desc: Papa tells his fractured version of the Jack and the Beanstalk story to the Bavarian mouse trio.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (2/39)
programme.desc: The gang get more than they bargained for when they try to shoo away a seemingly docile spider.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (3/39)
programme.desc: When Rick and Ginger forget Tom's birthday, the tomcat moves in with the one person who appreciates him -- the local Zoo's gorilla, Cuddles.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (4/39)
programme.desc: To Tom and Jerry's delight Ginger's new no junk food in the house diet causes Rick to sleep walk every night to the local fast food joint.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (5/39)
programme.desc: A prehistoric Cave Cat arrives at Rick and Ginger's house.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (6/39)
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry take the scouts on a camping trip to canyon country and get more than they bargained for when a coyote pup shows up.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (7/39)
programme.desc: Papa tells his fractured version of the Three Little Pigs story to the Bavarian mouse trio.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 2 (18/78)
programme.desc: It's Spike's birthday and he has been counting the days down. Every year, Rick goes all out to make it special, but not this one. He has forgotten! Seeing how sad Spike is, Tom and Jerry work together to give the pooch a birthday to remember. Unfortunately, their every effort backfires -- but don't worry, it ends happily.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (8/39)
programme.desc: A Tom and Jerry chase through Postlewaite Manor results in major injuries to Cates which places his defense of the Butler's Linen Gloves Boxing Title in jeopardy. But never fear, Tom will step into the ring and defend Cate's title.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (70/78)
programme.desc: In this fairy episode, due to a strike on the head and seeing the fairy story book pictures, the Lemmings believe they are the dwarves from the tale Snow White, and start attacking the cabin with pickaxes. After that Grizzy also believes he is Snow White due to same incidence.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (71/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings' favorite chocolate spread brand is organizing a big competition where the prize is a giant jar of spread. To win, one must make ten baskets in a row in a hoop set up on a supermarket parking lot for the occasion. Ready to play?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (72/78)
programme.desc: After being frozen for millions of years, a saber-toothed bear bursts into the cabin looking for food.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (73/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings discover a top-secret Canadian Army prototype that allows you to pass through solid surfaces for a window of several seconds.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (74/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings have found an Amerindian eagle amulet that endows he who wears it with the powers of a bird of prey. Grizzy would like to impress his beloved she-bear by soaring majestically through the sky. But to confiscate the magic totem from the Lemmings, who are now as sharp as eagles, Grizzy will have to use the cunning... of a puma.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (75/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings are having a blast with the ranger's electric guitar and the cabin walls tremble with their experimental rock. Just as Grizzy is about to destroy the instrument, he realizes it can make harmonious sounds too. Will this be enough to seduce the she-bear he's in love with?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (11/78)
programme.desc: After receiving a terrible blow over the head, Grizzy is no longer the same: he thinks he's a rodent! He tries to get the gang to adopt him so that he might participate in their fun and games like any other Lemming. But it's not long before his newfound comrades start to find him rather heavy!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (12/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy is exhausted and the couch has never seemed so enticing! He goes to fetch a pillow and a sleeping mask, but the Lemmings have entirely different plans for the couch. They see it as a fabulous trampoline and the ideal spot for an aerobics session. To win the right to have his nap, the weary bear must first contend with the super-energetic Lemmings!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (13/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers that the frenzied "break dance" the Lemmings are doing is actually due to the fleas they are infested with. When Grizzy catches them too, it's panic all round! Grizzy is determined to eliminate the parasites, down to the very last one. The problem is his little roommates have no desire whatsoever to be treated...

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (14/78)
programme.desc: Another heat wave: even the riverbed is dried up. One very thirsty Grizzy discovers that the Lemmings have used the last remaining bottles of water to fill their inflatable pool. He has no intention of letting the Lemmings swim in what might very well be his last chance to quench his thirst.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (15/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings have caught a little spider. Her sticky, elastic threads are absolutely perfect for bungee jumping. Grizzy, who has no intention of getting caught in the web, decides to crush the insect. The only problem: he discovers that he has arachnophobia, which is seriously going to complicate the task.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (16/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings fight over chocolate-spread jar lids, which they use as chips in a competition to win goodies. Indeed, next to the supermarket are two jackpot-style machines with slots the size of the lids. But more importantly, there's a key to be won that makes you eligible for the grand prize... the giant jar of Yummy on display under a glass cover.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (17/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy has prepared himself a TV dinner to eat in front of his favorite series. But his moment of pleasure is abruptly interrupted by unexplained static. Grizzy rapidly discovers that the true "interference" is the Lemmings, who are using the TV antenna as a diving board for their water games.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 3 (12/26)
programme.desc: Mr. Bean accidentally spills all of Mrs. Wicket’s new expensive perfume on the floor. In an attempt to hide his crime and refill the empty bottle he tries to recreate the smell – by adding all sorts of odd and strange ingredients. He might be able to fool Mrs. Wicket but can he fool Scrapper and all the neighbourhood cats?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 3 (13/26)
programme.desc: Mr Bean is on his way to the seaside when the mini runs out of petrol. Undeterred he manages to get a push but for some reason the do-gooders don’t want to push him all the way to the beach! Instead he uses wind power piggy backs on a car transporter and 802harnesses up some horses to try and get to his destination.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 3 (14/26)
programme.desc: Scrapper gives Bean fleas and Bean is forced to call in the pest control person. His flat will take 24 hours to fumigate. Bean begs Mrs. Wicket to let him stay with her. She agrees as long as Bean helps her with cooking cleaning etc. 24 hours later and Bean is desperate to see the back of her. The feeling is mutual. But then Mrs. Wicket starts itching …

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 3 (15/26)
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is out shopping when it starts to rain. Taking refuge in a trendy coffee bar Bean is fascinated both by the brewing machinery and the amount of money people will pay for small cups of coffee! Scenting a fortune to be made Bean opens up his own strange successful coffee bar …

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 3 (16/26)
programme.desc: Mr. Bean wakes up on a freezing cold winter’s morning to discover that the boiler is broken and no sign of the repairman. He tries increasingly ridiculous ways to warm up his tea his toothpaste and himself before venturing out to discover somewhere to hunker down and get warm.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 3 (17/26)
programme.desc: Irma wants a romantic break; Bean doesn’t. It’s too expensive. Irma kidnaps Teddy and refuses to give him back unless Bean promises to take her to Paris. Caught between his inability to pay and his love of Teddy Bean doesn’t know what to do! Until he spots a cat beauty competition in which first prize is a romantic break in Paris – if only he can catch Scrapper …

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 3 (18/26)
programme.desc: Bean wants to avoid lunch with Irma’s Mum at all costs. He persuades Mrs. Wicket to let him join her on a coach trip to a concert – but he has to disguise himself as an old-aged pensioner or he won’t be allowed on the coach. Once on the coach Bean drives everyone mad with his anti-boredom antics.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 3 (19/26)
programme.desc: Bean is showing Irma his favourite tree in the park one day when he discovers a tree surgeon getting ready to cut it down. He darts up the tree and won’t come back down. Irma loves this new side of Bean-ey! The tree surgeon is frustrated and tries various ploys to get Bean down. But can Bean make it to the toilet without being discovered and still save that tree?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (3/52)
programme.desc: Mr Bean drives his favourite Teddy to the cinema to see his favourite movie - 'Titanic'. Now he simply has to park the car. But when you're Mr Bean, nothing's simple. His ingenious efforts to find a parking space are persistently foiled. And the clock is ticking....

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (5/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings fight over the tablet. During their scuffle, they knock over an army crate which falls into the middle of the bamboo forest surrounding the cabin. Alerted by the noise, a peace missionary panda comes out of the forest and tries to calm down the worked-up adversaries. But will the limitless strategies of Grizzy and the Lemmings get the better of the panda's patience?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (6/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings create a shadow puppet show where seven papercut lemmings confront a bear over a jar of Yummy chocolate spread. The Lemmings in the audience are super enthusiastic, but Grizzy is outraged by the treatment inflicted upon the bear. He decides to intervene and equips the paper bear with an armor and saber! The Lemmings retort with ninja effigies of themselves and mount an attack to recover the coveted jar of Yummy spread.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (7/78)
programme.desc: As Grizzy relaxes in the massage chair, a cloud drifts in front of the sun, immediately stopping the electricity supply in the log cabin. The voltage drops continue, even though the sky seems clear now. Grizzy looks out the window and a dragon appears on the horizon! Once over his initial fright, the bear realizes that it's only a kite flown by the Lemmings – using the electricity from the cabin they have rerouted!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (8/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy dismantles the toboggan built by the Lemmings in the log cabin and reemploys the bamboo sticks to build a jacuzzi. When the Lemmings discover the bear's piece of work, they imagine a giant waterpark dominated by an immense waterslide. Anticipating the Lemmings' desire, Grizzy tries to barricade himself inside but the rodents manage to eject him from the cabin. The bear comes back, protected by a super bamboo armor…

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (9/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings organize a drone race throughout the cabin. Grizzy, who was on the verge of falling asleep, interrupts the competition but must contend with the rodents' reprisals. Thrown out of the cabin, the bear falls onto a temple dedicated to the Monkey King. He appropriates the statue's powers, operating a magic cloud by remote control. Grizzy settles in on the cloud and wins the race before the Lemmings. But a cloud that flies that fast can only arouse lust…

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (10/78)
programme.desc: To trick Grizzy's vigilance and steal the TV, the Lemmings, disguised as traditional Chinese dancers, perform a number that leaves the bear flabbergasted. The rodents take advantage of their diversion to carry off the TV set on their airborne craft made of Chinese umbrellas. But before they can escape with their bounty, Grizzy recovers the screen. Ever as determined, the Lemmings come back after upgrading their vessel.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (11/78)
programme.desc: Annoyed by a noisy high-speed chase between the Lemmings and a raccoon, Grizzy abruptly stops the game. The players fall into empty space and land in a clearing. The impact of their crash-landing cracks a black and white tile representing Yin and Yang and a strange light pours over the raccoon. Depending on his mood, the color of his fur changes, and his excitement or calm become contagious to all those around him!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (29/52)
programme.desc: Alice loves adventures in the wilderness. So imagine her joy at having the opportunity to accompany her friends on a trip to look for CutieTwees – the magic little critters that embellish Wonderland with their various colors! It’s also a chance for Alice and Lewis to see how the Twins go about taming these wild creatures. But a word of warning: one must be careful at all times while out in the wild, especially when you’re dealing with critters with extraordinary powers!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (30/52)
programme.desc: Feeling in a jokey mood, Alice catches up with Lewis while he’s paying a visit to the Book-Wizard. Unfortunately, the latter doesn’t appreciate the little girl’s jokes! And when the Queen turns up on the scene, he tells the two friends to leave. But in her hasty departure, Alice accidentally takes a piece of paper with a treasure map drawn on it! Unable to resist, she heads off to hunt for said treasure… which turns out to be the Book-Wizard’s joke book which he had purposefully buried to make sure the Queen would never come across it. Oops!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (31/52)
programme.desc: Alice has to learn a bunch of math for a school test. She pays a visit to Lewis, hoping he might be able to help her. But his method is so efficient that Alice learns EVERYTHING! Wow – couldn’t ask for more! However, when she goes back to the real world, she makes a fool of herself during the test: all the knowledge she has is Wonderland knowledge, which has nothing to do with that of the real world. Oops – she’d better get back and see Lewis fast so they can find a solution to this tricky equation!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (32/52)
programme.desc: Alice suggests she and Lewis make a film as a birthday gift for the Twee Twins: Lewis will play the hero, “Super Lewis!” With Charlie and Chester helping them, the shoot starts off swimmingly! But the Queen muscles in on the project and, before long, she’s acting like a total egocentric movie-star diva! To the detriment of the film, and much to Lewis’ dismay. But Alice gets an idea: what if they were to call the Queen’s bluff…? It’s going to be a very interesting screening!

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (36/78)
programme.desc: Mike decides to try to win Iris's affection by singing her a romantic musical number. As Mike has zero musical ability he uses Stephan's old vinyl records, but things don't go as planned because to Mike's horror, Fluffy and Mercury decide to hijack the proceedings and try their hand at being DJs. However, Mike's not going to let them spoil things. The show must go on!

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (37/78)
programme.desc: Mike's over the moon! He's going to spend the afternoon with the neighbor's dog. Except that it's not Iris, it's Duchess, a pug just like Mike and she instantly falls in love with our hero. Uh oh! The raccoons meanwhile are trying to break into the house and Duchess is trying to help. Mike panics. What if Iris discovers her new rival?

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (38/78)
programme.desc: Mike recreates a fun fair on the patio as a great way to impress Iris. He decorates the terrace and invites her over. However, there's no way the raccoons are going to miss such a fantastic opportunity to rob the house. Between the ghost train, coconut shy and the raccoons, Mike is going to have his hands full.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (39/78)
programme.desc: Mike's chess game with Iris is rudely interrupted by a loud commotion from the house. Fluffy has found the robotic vacuum and is riding it around the house like a stunt cat. Meanwhile, the racoons use the distraction to try to get their hands on their very own Holy Grail - a huge sausage xxx is saving for dinner. Mike will need every ounce of his smarts to chase the raccoons from the house and save Fluffy from the clutches of the demonic vacuum.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (40/78)
programme.desc: Mercury is rummaging through the trash bin and digs out a piece of rotten, disgusting Camembert. He wolfs the rancid cheese down, turning his breath into a weapon of mass destruction. Thinking quickly, Freddy uses Mercury's pungent breath to help them rob the Mikklesens. This mortifies Mike, who is having Iris over for dinner. Mike has no choice but to fight fire with fire. A stinky fight breaks out and there can only be one winner!

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (41/78)
programme.desc: The turtles have a falling out and Aramis decides she's had enough and stalks off. The other two turtles realize that things aren't the same without their best friend and turn to Mike for help. Mike organizes a search party to find their missing friend. Mercury and Aramis become unlikely allies and Freddy sees a way to exploit this new friendship for his own selfish ends.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (42/78)
programme.desc: Things are mysteriously disappearing from the Mikkelsen's house and Mike can't seem to get to the bottom of it. The raccoons have find an ingenious way to sneak in right under Mike's nose without being noticed by using the air vents! By the time Mike catches on, the racoons are mid-heist and they've kidnapped Fluffy in the process. Mike now has to decide whether he saves Fluffy or stops the racoons from making off with their loot.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (37/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings play kite-surf with a homemade kite. Grizzy notices that the she-bear he's in love with watches the kite perform arabesques in the sky with admiration. He decides to make a kite that is far more sophisticated than the Lemmings kite.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (38/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy snatches the last jar of chocolate spread out from under the noses of the Lemmings. In exchange, he offers them the toy stuck inside the lid: a mini-flute. When the Lemmings blow into the flute, the shrill notes that come out paralyze anyone whose ears aren't plugged for several seconds. They decide to play a tune for Grizzy in order to recover their share of chocolate spread.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (39/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings play a new game, floating like flags in the breeze from the fan which is set at maximum. Grizzy, who has decided to watch his favorite TV documentary on salmon fish, quickly rids the living room of this interference. But he didn't anticipate that the Lemmings would continue their game on the roof with the wind pump and TV antenna, and that the interference would reappear... inside the TV!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (40/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings have a grand old time tearing down their Kapla block buildings, which they rebuild just as fast. Grizzy remarks that the she-bear he's in love with is impressed by the Lemmings' construction and makes believe that it's his work of art. But when the building collapses yet again, the she-bear walks off. Grizzy decides to build an even bigger one.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (41/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings draw inspiration from lessons they find in a

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (65/78)
programme.desc: A magic horn lands on the muzzle of a moose, endowing it with grace and the ability to fly. It soars off, leaving a rainbow-colored streak in its wake. When Grizzy sees this strange creature, he dreams of taming it as a gift for his beloved she-bear, while the Lemmings imagine themselves playing rodeo on a bucking unicorn.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (42/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy dreams that he's a valiant knight who has just delivered his beloved. As he is about to take her in his arms, he is woken by the din of the Lemmings, who have chosen this particular day to blast music. Grizzy has only one desire: pick up his dream where he left off. But first, he'll have to stop the Lemmings' fiesta.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (14/78)
programme.desc: Mike tries to brighten Iris's day by putting together an impromptu circus on the patio. Mike plays ringmaster as Fluffy pretends to be a wild tiger and the raccoons put on an acrobatic show. But the sticky-fingered raccoons want to steal Tom's pogo stick and ruin the circus. The show must go on!

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (15/78)
programme.desc: When Stephan brings a new robot into the house that looks exactly like Mike, he gets an idea. He can use the robot as his stunt double and impress Iris. But before Mike can put his plan into action the raccoons stumble across the robot as they try to break in and tie it up thinking it's Mike. Can the real Mike chase the racoons away without Iris discovering the fraud?

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (16/78)
programme.desc: It's sweltering outside and Mike has invited Iris onto the terrace for a cooling cocktail. But the raccoons steal the ice maker. A chase ensues and the ice maker ends up in the pool, transforming it into an ice rink. The turtles are in seventh heaven while Mike and the Raccoons fight for control of the ice maker. Hockey, Curling, Ice Skating... it's a Mike On Ice Special.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (17/78)
programme.desc: Mercury suffers a huge blow to the head while trying to break into the Mikkelsen's house. When he wakes up, to Mike's great surprise, he seems to be acting like a dog. Now our hero has a new ally... one who quickly turns into a rival when he starts to flirt with Iris. Things get even more complicated when Freddy plots to bring his brother back to his old self, and more importantly... his partner in crime.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (18/78)
programme.desc: Tom leaves his beautiful train set out in the house and the raccoons see it as a fantastic way to ship their loot back to their den. Mike has other ideas. He's not about to let the pair of pesky varmints get away with it. It's a showdown between the good, the bad and the Fluffy.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (19/78)
programme.desc: Mike comes up with new plan to win Iris's affection by showering her with a cascade of rose petals. To do it, he needs to borrow Stephan's leaf blower. The only snag is that the raccoons also want to use the leaf blower to rob the house and Fluffy can't resist getting on the act. Mike has to come up with a pretty crazy solution to win the day.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (20/78)
programme.desc: There's nothing better than a little magic trick to impress your crush. Iris isn't the only one impressed when Mike puts on a magic show and multiplies some objects with just a flick of his wand. The raccoons decide to steal his magic wand so they can turn their solitary chicken wing into a sumptuous feast. But the raccoons have underestimated Mike the Magic Trickster.

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (31/63)
programme.desc: Lola and Victor have the same knapsacks and by mistake, they have switched them around. Lola really wants to get hers back because her private diary is inside but the Guanos would really like to have the pretty knapsack for themselves. Pat to the rescue!

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (32/63)
programme.desc: Hoodie has been chosen as the mascot for a popular brand of kitty kibble but the Guanos are jealous and do all they can to steal the spotlight. Pat is going to have to step in.

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (33/63)
programme.desc: Lola has made a tiki for the local festival. She asks Pat to keep an eye on it but Hoodie and the Guanos are very intrigued by it!

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (34/63)
programme.desc: Lola is helping Lucie to practice her yoga postures for an upcoming test while Pat is going to do everything possible to make sure there are no noisy disturbances so they will succeed.

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (35/63)
programme.desc: Lola and Victor have a race. The winner takes home the trophy that Lola’s father won when he was a kid. But Marcus, drawn to the trophy, is going to enter the race too! Pat will do everything he can to stop him from winning.

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (36/63)
programme.desc: Lola is going to try and find a treasure that is depicted on an old map belonging to her father. Pat will have to help her find it...before the Guanos do!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (29/52)
programme.desc: Alice loves adventures in the wilderness. So imagine her joy at having the opportunity to accompany her friends on a trip to look for CutieTwees – the magic little critters that embellish Wonderland with their various colors! It’s also a chance for Alice and Lewis to see how the Twins go about taming these wild creatures. But a word of warning: one must be careful at all times while out in the wild, especially when you’re dealing with critters with extraordinary powers!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (30/52)
programme.desc: Feeling in a jokey mood, Alice catches up with Lewis while he’s paying a visit to the Book-Wizard. Unfortunately, the latter doesn’t appreciate the little girl’s jokes! And when the Queen turns up on the scene, he tells the two friends to leave. But in her hasty departure, Alice accidentally takes a piece of paper with a treasure map drawn on it! Unable to resist, she heads off to hunt for said treasure… which turns out to be the Book-Wizard’s joke book which he had purposefully buried to make sure the Queen would never come across it. Oops!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (31/52)
programme.desc: Alice has to learn a bunch of math for a school test. She pays a visit to Lewis, hoping he might be able to help her. But his method is so efficient that Alice learns EVERYTHING! Wow – couldn’t ask for more! However, when she goes back to the real world, she makes a fool of herself during the test: all the knowledge she has is Wonderland knowledge, which has nothing to do with that of the real world. Oops – she’d better get back and see Lewis fast so they can find a solution to this tricky equation!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (17/52)
programme.desc: Alice is convinced she’s a really talented painter! But when it’s time to help Lewis paint the Queen’s Not-Birthday cake, it becomes painfully clear that she was mistaken! Fortunately, one of the Queen’s Cards is an ace cake-maker and offers to get them out of this fix by giving them one of his creations. Accepting his offer, our friends learn that trying to pass oneself off as something one is not really isn’t a good idea!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (32/52)
programme.desc: Alice suggests she and Lewis make a film as a birthday gift for the Twee Twins: Lewis will play the hero, “Super Lewis!” With Charlie and Chester helping them, the shoot starts off swimmingly! But the Queen muscles in on the project and, before long, she’s acting like a total egocentric movie-star diva! To the detriment of the film, and much to Lewis’ dismay. But Alice gets an idea: what if they were to call the Queen’s bluff…? It’s going to be a very interesting screening!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (10/78)
programme.desc: While fighting over a jar of chocolate spread, Grizzy and the Lemmings set off a chain reaction which sends the jar flying into space, where it damages the space station. Amongst the debris that falls in front of the cabin, the Lemmings discover a box that cancels out gravity.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (9/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers the ranger's collection of bird calls by chance. With a simple blow of the whistle, he can attract a flock of partridges that are at his beck and call. For Grizzy, it's a super-practical way of being waited on by feathered servants, while the Lemmings see it as a golden opportunity to have a squadron which obeys at the drop of a dime.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (8/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings notice that Grizzy moves away from the jar of chocolate spread whenever he chases the fly buzzing around him. But the insect can never hold out long enough for the Lemmings to swipe the jar before being knocked out. They decide to give the fly intensive sports training.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (13/78)
programme.desc: A magic tomahawk divides Grizzy into two identical bears with diametrically opposite personalities: one short-tempered, the other super-sweet. The Lemmings, who did not witness Grizzy's split, will have a hard time working out the behavior of their usual enemy, who seems to swing from excessive kindness to the worst trickery for no reason.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (11/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy finds a magician's hat that tosses out objects stored inside beforehand with the tap of a magic wand. He decides to impress his beloved she-bear with a magician's act. But he will have to work around the Lemmings, who have the gift of coming out of the hat at the wrong moment.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (16/78)
programme.desc: A newly unpacked UV tanning booth holds the place of honor in the middle of the cabin. Grizzy gets it into his head that a classy tan will help him draw the attention of the she-bear he's enamored with. When he opens the box, he discovers that the Lemmings have beat him to it and are already playing "beach party" inside the bed.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (51/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy wants to get rid of the old piano in the garage at any cost, for the Lemmings love using it to make a dissonant racket. But when he happens to notice that the she-bear he's in love with likes the melody of "Für Elise" he decides to learn the learn the piece like a real pro.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (12/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy wants to try out the brand new packaging format of chocolate spread that he discovers in the ranger's cupboard: a yummy-looking XXL jar. And he does not intend to share it with the Lemmings. After observing a chameleon toad that is able to blend into its surroundings, the Lemmings decide to make themselves invisible to attain Grizzy's treasure.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (2/78)
programme.desc: Mike is forced to live out a dog's worst nightmare... wearing a cone around his neck after a trip to the veterinarian! Oh, the humiliation! There's NO WAY he can let Iris see him like this. Mike refuses to leave the house and the raccoons take advantage of his self-enforced quarantine to rob the terrace. Now Mike has to come up with an ingenious scheme to defeat the raccoons without leaving the house and without being seen by Iris.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (3/78)
programme.desc: Mike's attempt to impress Iris with his diving skills backfires when he crashes into the bottom of an empty concrete swimming pool. Unfortunately, the thrill-loving Turtles drained the water out of the pool to turn it into a skate park. With Mike stranded, Iris comes to the rescue. The raccoons use it as an opportunity to trap Mike and raid the house. Mike will need to find a way out of this concrete prison.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (4/78)
programme.desc: A gust of wind sends Iris's favourite hat up onto the Mikkelsen's roof and Mike sees the perfect chance to retrieve it and look like a hero. He borrows Stephan's drone to complete his mission, except when the drone's remote control falls into the raccoon's hands, he's going to be experiencing more turbulence than he was expecting.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (5/78)
programme.desc: Mike gets a stroke of artistic inspiration and decides to sculpt a life-sized statue of Iris. Meanwhile the raccoons decide they need to steal Tom's robot from the house so they can effortlessly transport their future stolen loot back to their lair. A confrontation is inevitable so Mike turns his sculpting skills to build himself a suit of armor so he can defend he territory and retrieve Tom's robot.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (6/78)
programme.desc: Stephan has lost his keys again but he doesn't think Mike is the right dog for the job to find them. Mike sets out to prove his owner wrong, sparking an investigation worthy of an episode of CSI. As the clues pile up, the raccoons look like the most likely suspects. Elementary my dear Mike? Not at all.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (7/78)
programme.desc: Mike's worst nightmare comes true when Louise digs out her old toy Chikie from her trunk. Chikie is a horrifying squeaky toy that used to haunt Mike's dreams when he was a pup. Mike can't bear to be anywhere near it and the raccoons discover the perfect solution to keep Mike out of their way. Mike's going to have to use his other senses if he has any chance of overcoming hsi fear and defeating the raccoons.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (8/78)
programme.desc: Mike's yoga session is rudely interrupted when Fluffy comes to annoy him. Mike pushes him away and Fluffy ends up landing in a bag of charcoal. When Fluffy steps out he looks just like a baby racoon! His disguise is so good that Freddy and Mercury are both convinced he's an aspiring thief just like them. Now Mike is forced to face not just two masked thieves... but three.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (50/78)
programme.desc: Things go awry when Cates orders Tom to clean and inspect the family automobile. Tom, Jerry and Tuffy end up taking the car into the countryside and doing their best to control it. As Tom reads and attempts to follow the instruction manual, Jerry and Tuffy help, but they also suffer many near-misses.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (59/78)
programme.desc: When Tom finds out he won a contest to be in a cat food commercial, his behavior turns smug. This irritates Jerry, who goes to great lengths to ruin the commercial shoot at the house as Tom struggles in his role.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (58/78)
programme.desc: Cates appears and assigns Tom the job of sweeping the estate's chimneys, warning him not to upset the Duchess's new exotic pet bird. Unfortunately, both the pet bird and a stork at the top of the chimney think Jerry is a worm. Soon chaos breaks out, hurting Tom's cleaning efforts.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (54/78)
programme.desc: In Catsylvania, a strange flying bug bites Tom, transforming him into a Tom-sized bug monster. Van Mouseling saves the village with an old-fashioned canister of bug poison, and Tom flies off to the abandoned castle on the hill. But Tom's troubles aren't over yet! Inside, he must deal with huge spider webs and a spider the size of a truck.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (52/78)
programme.desc: Bedfordshire Bertie, a champion show horse, runs away and hides on the estate grounds, where Jerry does his best to help her hide from nosey Tom. Bertie is stressed out over a big upcoming meet, but Jerry has a calming effect on her. When Tom catches up with them, he, too, helps the horse overcome her nerves and get back to her old self.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (63/78)
programme.desc: Because of an injured foot, Rick stays home with Ginger's mother, Rosemary, taking care of him. Rosemary brings her infamous fat-free-dairy-free whole wheat gravy, and she quickly puts Rick, Spike and Tom on nutritious diets. Antics and fights break out as Rick and the pets crave real food.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (58/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy has got it into his head to offer a butterfly to the she-bear he's in love with. But the Lemmings fight with him over the rare specimens he's spotted, for they want to play helicopter. The butterfly hunt is on!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (59/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings have discovered an addictive new game based on the astonishing bouncing properties of the ranger's new running shoes. Grizzy, who is trying to relax, confiscates the shoes and soon realizes they are far more comfortable than his thongs.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (60/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy babysits for the she-bear he has a crush on, who has entrusted him with the care of her cub. There's no question of Grizzy tripping up, for he has no intention of taking any risks! But he hadn't reckoned on the Lemmings. Captivated by the baby's burps after meals, they dream of making it drink gallons of soda pop to make it do the "Big One."

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (61/78)
programme.desc: Unwilling to share the food both he and the Lemmings are wild

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (62/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy is impressed by the TV show of a magician who transforms a partridge into a bouquet of flowers. To get rid of the Lemmings once and for all, for they exasperate him with their incessant games, Grizzy tries the magic trick on them. And apparently... it works!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (63/78)
programme.desc: It's hot out and when Grizzy sees an ice cream commercial on TV, he has a sudden craving. Unfortunately, the Lemmings made it to the deep-freeze in the garage before him and emptied it out to make themselves a sled run in the backyard with strawberry-vanilla ice cream. For Grizzy, there's no question that the stock they possessively watch over in an icebox winds up as powder snow!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (12/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy wants to try out the brand new packaging format of chocolate spread that he discovers in the ranger's cupboard: a yummy-looking XXL jar. And he does not intend to share it with the Lemmings. After observing a chameleon toad that is able to blend into its surroundings, the Lemmings decide to make themselves invisible to attain Grizzy's treasure.

programme.title: Batwheels: Secret Origin of the Batwheels
programme.desc: When a devious plot draws Batman, Robin, and Batgirl away from the Batcave, the Batcomputer installs copies of her motherboard in the Bat-Vehicles to bring them to life. The newly-minted Batwheels are assigned the monumental task of defending the exposed Batcave and facing off with their villainous counterparts, the Legion of Zoom, led by the dastardly supervillain BADCOMPUTER – all without Batman’s help!

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (51/52)
programme.desc: When Skiff gets a crack in his hull, Thomas needs to move him overland to Harwick for repairs. But Skiff’s discomfort on flat land makes that challenging. With the help of Sandy, Carly, Diesel, and a very reluctant Troublesome Truck, Thomas finds a way for the water-loving Skiff to sail over the rails with ease.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (52/52)
programme.desc: When Nia suggests that they add a song to spice up Sir Topham Hatt’s unveiling of a new bench at Knapford... he calls upon her to write the song – a new Song of Sodor! When everyone starts giving their suggestions for what should be in the song, Nia gets annoyed and asks for a little space to think. In the end, Sandy and an unexpected Troublesome Truck might help Nia come up with a solution for the song of the season.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (1/52)
programme.desc: After accidentally derailing Gordon, Thomas promises to deliver Gordon's cargo to Whiff's Recycling Plant while racing with Diesel to get there first! As the competition gets heated and cargo is dropped, friends help Thomas pick up the pieces and remember that keeping the promise to Gordon is what will make Thomas the number one engine.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (2/52)
programme.desc: Thomas is excited about a rocket launch happening at Brendam Docks. When he’s tasked with delivering a small battery, he puts it off to help the other engines deliver the big exciting rocket pieces. But when Thomas gets to the rocket launch he realizes the only thing they’re missing is the battery - without it, the rocket can't take off! He'll need to race back to deliver the battery on time, or else the rocket will never launch!

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (3/52)
programme.desc: The lightbulb has gone out at the lighthouse and Percy is tasked with making a nighttime delivery of a new bulb to replace it. Percy is afraid of the dark, so Thomas makes up a fun game that he and Percy are 001 and 006 spies to help Percy cope with his fear along the way. Along the way the two friends will face the dark, and Percy might learn a thing or two about courage.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (4/52)
programme.desc: At Knapford Maintenance Yard, Thomas constructs his ideal obstacle course. However, none of the trains can do the course because Thomas only built it for his abilities and is adamant that they do it his way. The trains leave defeated and as Thomas goes to make amends with each of them, he sees them each using their unique strengths as they work. Thomas rebuilds the obstacle course to cater to the other train’s abilities, but will it be enough to repair their friendship?

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (5/52)
programme.desc: Annie and Clarabel have a nighttime delivery so they need to get to their destination that day well rested. Thomas volunteers to take them but must remain quiet to let them sleep the whole ride. Thomas has a really difficult time keeping quiet with lots of noisy impulses, places and things he passes, almost waking Annie and Clarabel. Thomas is eventually joined by Percy, and they even sing a lullabye, but they'll find out whether or not it's enough to last them the whole ride.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (6/52)
programme.desc: Thomas loves to race Kana. He uncharacteristically wins when her power goes out. Unable to move fast, she may not make it to her destination before sunset. Usually, Kana only takes the fastest route and everything goes by in a blur, but Thomas might be able to help her take things slow for a change.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (7/52)
programme.desc: It's Thomas's job to deliver a giant wooden dragon at the Medieval Faire at Kirk Ronan. The other engines want a turn, so they all compete to catch the dragon, pretending to be knights, thinking whoever catches it will get to deliver it. The engines are hurt when Thomas clears up the misunderstanding and would like the job to remain his. Thomas will need to learn that when he's working with a team, it's important to share the effort.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (8/52)
programme.desc: Thomas finds a map to the special Crystal Locomotive landmark in the Crystal Caves and forms a Big Adventure Club to go explore. Sandy wants to come but her friends say she’s a little too small to join. Instead, Sandy recruits Diesel to go with her instead as part of her Bigger Adventure Club. In the twists and turns of the mine, the Big Adventure Club find themselves lost. Now it's up to Sandy and Diesel to find the Crystal Locomotive and bring everyone home.

programme.title: CoComelon - Season 1 (145/152)
programme.desc: It’s winter time, the air is cold, and there’s snow all over the ground! It’s time to go outside and play!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (52/52)
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is over the moon when he meets Mr. Pod because both men have so much in common; same shirt, jacket, trousers and underpants. And to top it all, Pod is Bean’s spitting image! Bean falls to Earth with a bump, though, when his girlfriend, Irma Gobb, finds Mr. Pod much better looking than him.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 2 (1/52)
programme.desc: Mr Bean is unimpressed with a horror movie he sees at the cinema and reckons he can do much better. Bean sets out to create his very own home movie masterpiece –featuring Mrs Wicket Irma and Teddy! The screening in the garden is a huge success but will Mrs Wicket be pleased with her makeover and starring role?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 2 (2/52)
programme.desc: Mr Bean has to look after Mrs Wicket’s pet goldfish while she is away. With a ravenous Scrapper sniffing around Bean ends up becoming more bodyguard than babysitter. But when he manages to lose his fishy friend Mr Bean takes a nightmare journey down the sewer and back to his neighbour’s house via the park. Can Mr Bean get the pesky pet back in the bowl before Mrs Wicket returns home?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 2 (3/52)
programme.desc: Mr Bean wins two tickets for an exotic cruise and naturally he takes Teddy along for the trip of a lifetime. Once aboard the huge ocean liner Mr Bean soon settles into a life of luxury but while showing off to a new friend Bean becomes ‘man overboard’ and stranded on a dessert island.
