The racoons skedaddle back to their lair, but instead of stealing the loot, Mercury brings back an old grandfather clock that belonged to the family's grandmother. Now Mike has to break into the raccoon's lair, retrieve the family heirloom and give the raccoons a taste of their own medicine.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (56/78)
programme.desc: Mike is running around like a headless chicken: saving Fluffy from danger, stopping the turtles from breaking everything in the house, and fighting the raccoons. He's in serious need of a break. Seeing how overworked Mike is, Iris and the turtles decide to take over Mike's duties for the day so the exhausted pooch can get a well-deserved rest. The friends mean well but they might have underestimated just how hard Mike's job is!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (49/78)
programme.desc: Like usual, Grizzy picks the door of the Ranger's log cabin to come in and make himself comfortable, but this time it's impossible to enter! The Lemmings have requisitioned the cabin for a party and barricaded themselves inside. Grizzy has no intention of waiting for an invitation to find a way to get in.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (50/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings have got their hands on a pack of white beans which have very strange properties: when mixed with soda, anyone who eats them turns into a bouncing ball. Grizzy realizes that if he wants to take a nap, he must first get rid of the magic beans.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (51/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy wants to get rid of the old piano in the garage at any cost, for the Lemmings love using it to make a dissonant racket. But when he happens to notice that the she-bear he's in love with likes the melody of "Für Elise" he decides to learn the learn the piece like a real pro.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (52/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings inherit a crate that fell off a Canadian army convoy transporting ultra-secret material. The case inside the crate emits a sort of laser beam that divides objects into multiple miniaturized versions of themselves. What if the Lemmings had to deal with lots of mini-Grizzys rather than just one big one?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (53/78)
programme.desc: Near the supermarket, a machine hands out surprise eggs in exchange for a coin. Amongst the lots to be won, there is a super firework rocket that makes the Lemmings dream, and a piece of costume jewelry that Grizzy imagines himself giving to his lady-love.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (67/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings have turned the cabin topsy-turvy and created an obstacle course to race through in a hamster ball. Grizzy intervenes and ousts both the Lemmings and their ball so that he can relax in peace. Unfortunately for him, he has tossed the Lemmings into a reserve of Zorb Balls, those giant inflatable spheres used to hurtle down slopes.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (54/78)
programme.desc: At the Ranger's home, Grizzy finds a high-tech gadget that enables you to learn anything at all sewing, origami, Kung Fu, etc... within only seconds thank to electrodes hooked to the brain. He can now become the perfect bear! But first, he first needs a program to learn how to get rid of the Lemmings.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (28/78)
programme.desc: If only Mike were a little bit more muscular, Iris would definitely look at him in a new light. At least that's what he tells himself when he sees Stephan's new workout bench. Unfortunately, it's not that easy. First, Mike needs to learn how to use it and the turtles and the racoons are doing everything they can to make the task more difficult. Muscles are one thing. Bruises are another.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (29/78)
programme.desc: Louise snaps a photo of Mike while they play a game together. The only problem is that Mike looks absolutely ridiculous in it. There's no way Mike can ever let Iris see it and he's going to do everything he possibly can to prevent the photo from falling into the wrong hands, but the raccoons have other ideas.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (30/78)
programme.desc: The turtles organize a sports contest and whoever wins gets a special trophy. Iris volunteers a reluctant Mike to take part in the games. Mercury joins in so he doesn't miss out on the fun. Mike's going to have to step up his game if he has any chance of beating Mercury, but he's not the only one who wants the trophy. Freddy has his eyes on it and he's not afraid to break the rules to get it.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (31/78)
programme.desc: The weather is miserable so Mike decides to stay in and catch up on his reading. However the book he's reading on Vampires is scarier than he bargained for. Pretty soon he's jumping out of his seat at every noise and squeak. When the racoons break in to the house try and raid the refrigerator for some rainy day snacks Mike decides to use his newfound knowledge of vampires to scare the pesky thieves right out of the house.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (32/78)
programme.desc: Mike has his work cut out for him when Stephan leaves a beautiful gift for his wife on the counter and goes to work for the day. The pesky raccoons decide to help themselves while the turtles fire up a huge game of Ice Hockey in the house and Fluffy also has eyes on the gift. Mike will need to pull out all the stops if he's going to rescue the gift from all the chaos.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (33/78)
programme.desc: It's Iris's birthday and Mike wants to surprise her with a special party. Balloons, gifts, Piñata, the works! Everything has been perfectly planned but the relentless raccoons decide to crash the party and steal all the candy. The racoons discover the helium tank Mike used to blow up the balloons... taking the battle between Mike and the racoons up into the sky.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (34/78)
programme.desc: While Mike prepares a special sushi dinner to win Iris's heart, the racoons break into the garage intent on creating some mischief. Somehow Freddy accidentally locks himself in the freezer and when Mike goes to the fridge for a piece of fish, Mercury mistakenly thinks it's Freddy who is on Mike's menu. Mercury has to save his brother and Mike needs to save his dinner!

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (43/63)
programme.desc: Lola discovers an old rocking horse that has been nibbled by termites. While she goes with her father to find an anti-termite spray, Pat is going to have to guard the ever-so fragile rocking horse from Hoodie but especially from the Guanos who are drawn like magnets to the delicious termites!

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (44/63)
programme.desc: Victor wants to play with Lola’s board game but she refuses to lend it to him because he never gives anything back. Victor gives one of his toys to Lola and then steals it back without her knowing, then tries to make her believe that she doesn’t take care of his toys either. Pat is going to have to recover the toy.

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (45/63)
programme.desc: Lola heads over to a film shoot so she can get a star to autograph a figurine she wants to give Hugo, who is sick. The Guanos are also big fans and try to steal the figurine. But of course Pat comes to the rescue.

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (46/63)
programme.desc: Lola can’t have anything to eat before she goes to see the doctor. So her mother has promised her a delicious meal once she comes home. Except that the Guanos are dying to get their claws on the meal. Pat is going to have to protect Lola’s coveted meal!

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (47/63)
programme.desc: For one of her homework assignments, Lola and her mother decide to grow tomatoes in the garden. Lola uses a worm to fertilize the soil but the Guanos are dying to get their claws on it. Pat is going to have to protect the worm so that Lola has the most beautiful tomatoes of all!

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (48/63)
programme.desc: Victor agrees to help Lola sweep the street as long as nothing happens to his game consol. But Marcus and Squizel are going to do everything they can to steal it. Pat to the rescue!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (37/52)
programme.desc: It’s a disaster! Narcissio, the Queen’s facetious little mirror has made her royal mole vanish! Alice and Lewis promise the monarch they’ll solve the problem by giving the mirror what it wants: the power to SHINE! She gives them until teatime to accomplish this. If they fail, both the mirror and Lewis will be shut up in a shoebox forever!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (38/52)
programme.desc: Alice is tired of losing every competitive situation she’s engaged in so far, today, so she decides to run as a candidate for the Wonderland elections, against Lewis: the winner will be the Clock’s custodian. The two candidates set about campaigning, to win votes from the Wonderlanders. And, when the time comes to go to the ballots, Alice actually wins, against all odds! But lacking experience, she gets in a total muddle with the clock’s workings! Mmm, could she have run against her best friend in the election for the wrong reason? Food for thought…

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (39/52)
programme.desc: There’s one thing that scares Alice more than anything: being made a fool of at the school fair! Meanwhile, in Wonderland, tonight is the Great Ball and the Queen insists Alice dance with Charlie. A word of caution, however: NO mistake is allowed in the Ball dance, and there’s no getting out of it either! To make matters worse, Charlie fully doesn’t have a sense of rhythm! Lewis, the dancer extraordinaire, steps in to help them get the moves down pat. Because if they mess up, Alice will be subjected to pure torture from the Mocking Hedges!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (19/52)
programme.desc: When Alice goes to Wonderland, she finds Lewis and the Twins cleaning up the Queen’s stuff. To gain time, she decides to lend them a hand. But in her haste to get the job done fast, she throws everything into a toy box, including the Queen’s plush toy! Unfortunately, the box in question works a bit like the blue doors that are dotted around Wonderland: the only way to recover the objects is to think of the place where you want them to go while you’re putting them in. Of course, Alice didn’t know this... And so, here we have the Queen’s plush toy royally lost! If Alice and the Twins don’t find it fast, Lewis is going to wind up the Queen’s plush toy from here on out!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (40/52)
programme.desc: Mom asks Alice to brush her teeth before going to bed but Alice deems it unnecessary and goes to see Lewis instead. Her rabbit friend is very busy, getting ready for the Wonderland Smile Contest, and he’s determined to win it, yet again. Unfortunately, however, the secret of his success – a “dazzle potion” – has mysteriously disappeared. Lewis and Alice are going to have to come up with a smart, alternative solution.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (26/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings have a blast testing every app on the ranger's tablet one by one. Grizzy, who is starving, sees that the cupboards are bare. When he realizes that one GPS app can give the itinerary to the nearest chocolate spread store, Grizzy requisitions the tablet.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (27/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings discover the ranger's latest acquisition: a 3D printer that will duplicate anything at all in miniature format. Grizzy wants to redecorate the cabin with figurines bearing his effigy, but first he needs to get rid of the Lemmings. Without getting them mixed up with their perfect resin replicas.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (28/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings discover a strange gateway to a parallel world. On the other side, there is the same cabin, only it doesn't belong to a ranger. It's a chocolate spread museum, where the curators are... another Grizzy and other Lemmings, all with very different personalities.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (29/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings clumsily destroy the TV remote control while fighting over who gets to watch their favorite program. While looking for a backup zapper, they happen onto a top secret Canadian Army prototype that enables you to apply the usual controls: "play," "pause" and "fast forward" to living beings.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (30/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings discover that by changing the speed limit sign on the side of the road, they can accelerate truck traffic and create a huge draft that is just perfect for their extreme kiting game. Grizzy would be more in favor of a "STOP!" or "No Entrance!" sign. A road sign battle begins.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (31/78)
programme.desc: While trying to stop the Lemmings from playing their extreme trampoline game, Grizzy slips on the canvas and unwittingly executes an amazing somersault in front of his beloved she-bear. Seeing that she wants more, Grizzy decides to become a champ in the sport. But for that to happen, the Lemmings will need to let him work out.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (53/78)
programme.desc: Near the supermarket, a machine hands out surprise eggs in exchange for a coin. Amongst the lots to be won, there is a super firework rocket that makes the Lemmings dream, and a piece of costume jewelry that Grizzy imagines himself giving to his lady-love.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (32/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings have hitched up a racoon with a sweet tooth to their sled and get a ride by throwing cookies in front of the creature with a sling. To recover the supply of cookies, which were to be his afternoon snack, Grizzy has no qualms about making the Lemmings' sled skid out of control. When the sled hits a superhero's spacecraft, a mysterious costume falls out.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (16/78)
programme.desc: It's sweltering outside and Mike has invited Iris onto the terrace for a cooling cocktail. But the raccoons steal the ice maker. A chase ensues and the ice maker ends up in the pool, transforming it into an ice rink. The turtles are in seventh heaven while Mike and the Raccoons fight for control of the ice maker. Hockey, Curling, Ice Skating... it's a Mike On Ice Special.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (17/78)
programme.desc: Mercury suffers a huge blow to the head while trying to break into the Mikkelsen's house. When he wakes up, to Mike's great surprise, he seems to be acting like a dog. Now our hero has a new ally... one who quickly turns into a rival when he starts to flirt with Iris. Things get even more complicated when Freddy plots to bring his brother back to his old self, and more importantly... his partner in crime.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (18/78)
programme.desc: Tom leaves his beautiful train set out in the house and the raccoons see it as a fantastic way to ship their loot back to their den. Mike has other ideas. He's not about to let the pair of pesky varmints get away with it. It's a showdown between the good, the bad and the Fluffy.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (19/78)
programme.desc: Mike comes up with new plan to win Iris's affection by showering her with a cascade of rose petals. To do it, he needs to borrow Stephan's leaf blower. The only snag is that the raccoons also want to use the leaf blower to rob the house and Fluffy can't resist getting on the act. Mike has to come up with a pretty crazy solution to win the day.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (20/78)
programme.desc: There's nothing better than a little magic trick to impress your crush. Iris isn't the only one impressed when Mike puts on a magic show and multiplies some objects with just a flick of his wand. The raccoons decide to steal his magic wand so they can turn their solitary chicken wing into a sumptuous feast. But the raccoons have underestimated Mike the Magic Trickster.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (21/78)
programme.desc: The racoons have fleas! They head over to Mike's to find something they can use to relieve the itch and pass the fleas onto Mike in the process. The timing couldn't be worse because Mike has a special date with Iris! Now Mike must do everything to avoid Iris, sparking an epic game of hide and seek. Mike has to get rid of the tiny intruders before they meet.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (22/78)
programme.desc: The crafty racoons manage to handcuff Mike's back legs together. The raccoons are convinced that with Mike incapacitated, they're finally going to manage to steal something from the house. But it's going to take a lot more than a pair of handcuffs to stop Mike, who has found some inventive ways to get around and boot the thieves out - even with his legs tied behind his back.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (64/78)
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry take a case for Toodles' cousin in Hawaii, hoping to sneak in some rest and relaxation, but it's no vacation. The cousin's missing pineapple plant is only the starting place of the investigation as Tom and Jerry track down the culprit in this tropical environment.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (71/78)
programme.desc: After Tyke digs up, Hammy, Spike's lucky bone, Spike reburies it right away because it's bad luck to remove it. Soon afterward, Tom gets a set of toy dog bones that do tricks, and he teases Spike and Tyke with them. When the whirly-bone buries itself and unearths Hammy for a second time, Spike recruits the other animals to help prevent the bad luck he expects.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (67/78)
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry take a case from a mother tortoise to find out where her son Seymour is sneaking off to at night. They discover Seymour is self-training to win a championship boxing match, planning to pay off bills with the prize money so his mom can quit the car wash. When he offers Tom and Jerry a cut of the money to keep his secret, they take it and agree to train him—but it won't be easy.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (66/78)
programme.desc: After entering Tyke in an agility contest, Spike sets up a course for the puppy in the backyard. Soon, Spike decides the course isn't hard enough and gets Tom to help, bending Tom into pretzel-like positions for Tyke to leap over, through, or into. After all this preparation, Tyke must still make it to the competition on time.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (75/78)
programme.desc: Jerry's high-born cousin Count DaCalories—a haughty city mouse—visits the estate. At first, he acts sleek and refined, but soon he can't resist pigging out and going on multiple kitchen raids. As his paunch grows, it becomes more and more difficult for him to outrun Tom and stay out of sight of the Duchess's visitor.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (70/78)
programme.desc: When Stinker, the trash-loving dog, comes by looking for help, Tom and Jerry aren't inclined to take the case until they hear it involves a missing fortune. So, they're disappointed when they find out Stinker is searching for a lost fortune cookie from his Chinese takeout to learn his fate. Retracing the dog's steps, they chase the fortune cookie's trail through town.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (70/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy finds a birthday piñata in the ranger's living room. The idea of bursting open a papier-mâché statue with a bat like it says in the instructions pleases him. The Lemmings, who prefer to use it as a toy to swing from, are determined to stop Grizzy from destroying the piñata.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (71/78)
programme.desc: Inside a mysterious cave, Grizzy and the Lemmings discover a magical Game of the Goose. The events displayed in the squares that the players land on come true in real life. When Grizzy and the Lemmings realize, it's too late to stop the game.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (72/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy is bothered by an object stuck in between the sofa cushions: a big fur lemming puppet glove. He puts his hand inside and has fun pretending that the puppet is strangling him. The Lemmings believe that the puppet is a Super Lemming who's stronger than Grizzy and start to obey it.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (73/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers the leftovers of a Halloween party in the ranger's cabin, which was entirely redecorated for the occasion, with stupefaction. But if the curious ambiance perturbs Grizzy, the Lemmings are in seventh heaven and have a whale of a time jumping up and down inside a cooking pot full of marshmallows. Grizzy wants to get rid of it until he accidentally swallows a marshmallow and discovers the best flavor of his life.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (74/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy wants to give the she-bear he's in love with a plastic ring which he finds really swell. But since the object was found in the trash, he needs to wash it first. And the Lemmings are using the sole bar of soap in the house as a bobsleigh.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (75/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy finds a strange American Indian figurine with the power to switch the spirits of two living beings and finds himself imprisoned in the body of a caribou. He immediately tries to activate the reverse procedure, but the Lemmings steal the figurine in order to turn into a partridge and fly away.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (20/78)
programme.desc: The fridge in the cabin has changed: it's been replaced by a brand new state-of-the-art appliance which analyzes the body fat percentage of whoever wants to serve himself, before selecting the appropriate foodstuffs. For Grizzy, no question of touching the chocolate spread or sodas! Instead, to the Lemmings' delight, the fridge transforms into an extreme exercise machine.

programme.title: Moley - Season 1 (17/52)
programme.desc: Moley and his mom enter Mishmosh’s yearly science fair while the Gardener and Squirm plot to snag Manny.

programme.title: Moley - Season 1 (18/52)
programme.desc: Moley and Dotty find themselves trapped inside Mishmosh’s lab when his state of the art security system is activated.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (1/78)
programme.desc: Nutty Hill is suffering from a stifling heat wave. Searching in vain for a bit of cool air, Grizzy suddenly has a brilliant idea. He'll get into the fridge, where the temperature will be more bearable. One slight detail, the refrigerator shelves are already full of Lemmings.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (2/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy is frustrated: just as he was about to coat a nice big fresh salmon with chocolate spread and snuggle up in front of the TV, he discovers that the pantry is empty! His frustration transforms into rage when he finds the last jar in the clutches of the Lemmings, who are organizing a sort of "beach party" in the sandbox.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (3/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy's nap is interrupted by an annoying vibrating. He sees the forest ranger's cell phone on the couch. It has various functions, including a game to which he instantly becomes addicted. However the Lemmings, who have already detected the phone's music app, need it in order to transform the garage into a discotheque.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (4/78)
programme.desc: Freed by the thawing ice, a mysterious giant egg slides up to the front door of the log cabin. The Lemmings watch the hatching of a large baby dinosaur that immediately mistakes them for his "mommies." Grizzy cannot tolerate a new intruder like this in the cabin, but how does one earn the respect of a gang of Lemmings armed with a T-Rex, even it is only a baby?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (5/78)
programme.desc: In order to seduce the she-bear he's infatuated with, Grizzy decides to take things in hand and slim down with the ranger's bodybuilding equipment. But before starting his exercise routine, he will first have to settle the problem of the Lemmings, who are already using the machines as an amusement park.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (6/78)
programme.desc: By chance, Grizzy discovers that the ranger's new robot vacuum cleaner also gives very pleasant back massages. But the Lemmings see the new gadget more as a competition bumper car. No one wants to do the housecleaning, but everyone wants the robot vacuum cleaner!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (7/78)
programme.desc: While searching for the television remote control, Grizzy discovers a gadget that controls various functions in the cabin. Hup! One button and there's light! Hup! Another surveys the house's nooks and crannies. Grizzy will finally be able to rid himself of the Lemmings, without even leaving the couch! But beware of losing control...

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (8/78)
programme.desc: To make sure that the Lemmings don't snatch his chocolate spread while he's taking his nap, Grizzy turns the fridge into a safe - combination lock and all. The Lemmings try in vain to break into the fridge until they see Grizzy open the door while sleepwalking. Unfortunately, Grizzy wakes up at the crucial moment. The Lemmings do everything possible to make him fall back asleep as quick as possible.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (9/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings have invented a new popcorn game which consists of throwing popcorn and catching it with their mouths. Grizzy notices that his lovely she-bear seems to be drawn by the scent of the grilled corn and decides to invite her over for a snack, just the two of them. But first, he must quickly recover the popcorn from the Lemmings.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (10/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy wants to learn to dance the mambo to please the she-bear he's in love with, for she truly adores this rhythm. He finds a learning kit at the ranger's home which has a dance carpet with footprints that light up in rhythm. The only problem is that Lemmings want the ghetto-blaster to continue their rave party to an entirely different beat.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (11/78)
programme.desc: After receiving a terrible blow over the head, Grizzy is no longer the same: he thinks he's a rodent! He tries to get the gang to adopt him so that he might participate in their fun and games like any other Lemming. But it's not long before his newfound comrades start to find him rather heavy!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (12/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy is exhausted and the couch has never seemed so enticing! He goes to fetch a pillow and a sleeping mask, but the Lemmings have entirely different plans for the couch. They see it as a fabulous trampoline and the ideal spot for an aerobics session. To win the right to have his nap, the weary bear must first contend with the super-energetic Lemmings!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (1/78)
programme.desc: With their endless battles over the ranger's cabin which they do not want to share, Grizzy and the Lemmings end up blowing the cabin up. Amidst the debris, they discover a strange pack: an army tent with all the necessary equipment to recreate a home in nature. It's the chance to discover the joys of camping in the wild.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (13/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers that the frenzied "break dance" the Lemmings are doing is actually due to the fleas they are infested with. When Grizzy catches them too, it's panic all round! Grizzy is determined to eliminate the parasites, down to the very last one. The problem is his little roommates have no desire whatsoever to be treated...

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (14/78)
programme.desc: Another heat wave: even the riverbed is dried up. One very thirsty Grizzy discovers that the Lemmings have used the last remaining bottles of water to fill their inflatable pool. He has no intention of letting the Lemmings swim in what might very well be his last chance to quench his thirst.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (53/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings have laid hand on special magnets which turn any object they are stuck to into flying objects. Grizzy bears the consequences and is ejected out of the cabin on his couch, which has turned into a flying-couch. Upon landing, Grizzy discovers by chance that the magnet stuck to his forehead enables him to fly like Peter Pan.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (15/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings have caught a little spider. Her sticky, elastic threads are absolutely perfect for bungee jumping. Grizzy, who has no intention of getting caught in the web, decides to crush the insect. The only problem: he discovers that he has arachnophobia, which is seriously going to complicate the task.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (27/78)
programme.desc: Red Herring complains to Tom and Jerry that he keeps hearing laughter everywhere he goes. Tom and Jerry bodyguard Red to prevent him from doing anything that might provoke laughter, but Red's goof-ups and fails soon have even them convulsed. Gradually, it gets loud enough that Tom and Jerry can hear it too. Will they find the true source of the laughter?

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (30/78)
programme.desc: On another scary night in the castle, The Invisible Cat wants nothing more than to catch mice. After it picks up and carries Jerry and Tuffy, Tom is really confused (and spooked) to see the two mice "magically" float through the air! When Tom accidentally smacks The Invisible Cat in the face and knocks Jerry and Tuffy free of his hold, it sparks a slapstick fight between the two cats.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (34/78)
programme.desc: While Rick and Ginger take a mountain hike, Tom and Jerry befriend three cute baby eaglets and help them learn to fly. However, soon Tom must face a bobcat.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (40/78)
programme.desc: When Rick and Ginger argue on their anniversary, Cupid decides to get involved. However, he gets a head injury in a chase between Tom and Jerry and forgets who he is. Now it's on Tom and Jerry to remind Cupid of his identity and help Ginger and Rick stop fighting.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (33/78)
programme.desc: Rick and Ginger wake up late and, in their hurry, they accidentally put dog food in Tom's bowl and cat food in Spike's. This causes Spike to behave like a cat and Tom to act like a dog. Although they're confused at first, they soon eat other types of food and discover how it makes them act.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (35/78)
programme.desc: Spike orders Tom and Jerry to watch Tyke while he's away, but instead Tom takes the opportunity to chase Jerry in the backyard. Suddenly, Tyke is nowhere to be seen and the front gate is wide open! Tom and Jerry must find the pup in time or face Spike's beating.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (37/78)
programme.desc: When Tom and Jerry go to a pool party at Toodles's place, Tom shows off in the pool with ridiculous stunts. Butch and Meathead arrive, adding more rivalry to the party. Soon, Toodles suggests they play a game of water polo, which reaches a fever pitch before long.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (36/78)
programme.desc: On the edge of the village of Catsylvania, Tom is carried off to Dr. Frankenstein's castle lab. Several lightning bolts later, a monster comes to life: a nine-foot-tall hulk with Tom's relatively tiny head sewn on. Frankenstein orders the monster to go terrorize the village, but it has problems focusing after Tom's head sees Jerry in the lab.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (41/78)
programme.desc: Ginger brings home an aerosol can of Rat Cop, rat and mouse repellent, to help Tom do his job. And it's not your typical rodent repellent! When the spray makes a human-shaped cop appear, it yells at Jerry and starts pursuit, along with Tom.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (38/78)
programme.desc: Spike the bulldog comes to Tom and Jerry, complaining he is being harassed by unknown creditors, ex-girlfriends, and other problems due to identity theft. They take the case on and go in search of who could be using Spike's name. It quickly becomes equally confusing for them to sort out.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (42/78)
programme.desc: Jerry and Tuffy discover Ginger's surprise for Rick in the garage: a brand-new air hockey table. They enjoy floating in zero gravity before Tom comes in and stops the fun. Soon, Butch challenges Tom to a game, until they start chasing Tuffy into the house and out back.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (43/78)
programme.desc: When Tom and Jerry break a picture frame on the wall, Rick gives Tom an ultimatum that he's out for good if he breaks one more thing. Despite Tom's earnest response, he breaks something right after Rick leaves to purchase a new frame. Attempting to fix the problem, Tom borrows tools and coveralls from a repair truck nearby but can't stop breaking things in the repair process.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (39/78)
programme.desc: A fast-talking sales cat named Dr. Jake L. appears to Tom from a trap door in the floor, selling "Ache-Eee Bones" tonic. However, when the doctor sees Jerry and Tuffy, he instantly turns into the slobbering Mr. Hyde-Cat and chases them, but then changes back to the doctor. Tom wants to buy the tonic but soon finds out what's happening with the visiting cat and tries to get rid of him.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (48/78)
programme.desc: Hoping to woo Toodles, Tom decides to make some homemade perfume for her. He throws in many unusual ingredients and gets a surprisingly pleasant outcome, getting the attention he craved. However, soon Tom and Jerry must come up with a plan when the heavenly scent turns bad.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 1 (21/52)
programme.desc: Dr. Bigby upgrades Bot to a Bot-y Guard. When Tom breaks in and sets off Bot's defensive systems things get out of control.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (44/78)
programme.desc: When Jerry overhears that a brand-new butler will arrive at the household later that day, the crafty mouse whips together a butler's outfit and knocks on the door, pretending to be the new arrival—to get unbridled access to the pantry. How long will Jerry's disguise work, and what happens when the real butler arrives?

programme.title: Moley - Season 1 (19/52)
programme.desc: Hurley, a giant boisterous adventuring mole who boasts of dangerous stories, comes to town looking to drag Moley on one of his adventures! Frightened of being thought a coward, Moley tries to avoid him.

programme.title: Moley - Season 1 (20/52)
programme.desc: When Moley and Dotty spot Old Coot sneaking around MoleTown, Dotty can’t resist following. Soon they discover his secret tunnel, but all is not what it seems.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 2 (12/52)
programme.desc: Mr Bean decides to take Teddy on holiday to the seaside. But when he arrives at his hotel a spoilt little girl wants Teddy all for herself. And her protective dad only wants the best for his ‘princess’. An on-going tussle ensues between Mr Bean the little girl and her Dad resulting in a chase across the seaside town and onto the pier. No one comes between Mr Bean Teddy and their ‘relaxing’ holiday!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 2 (13/52)
programme.desc: Mr Bean is left in peace when Mrs Wicket goes off on her holidays. This means Mr Bean has free access to her daily newspaper. But every time he goes down to collect it from the letterbox it disappears. Someone is taking it but who? Mr Bean is determined to nab the mysterious newspaper stealer and uses a range of ingenious homemade traps in his quest to catch the sneaky thief.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 2 (14/52)
programme.desc: Mr Bean is trying to find a nice quiet place to read his book so he sets off for the Library. But instead of reading he becomes distracted by some funny online videos he sees on the Library’s computer. Before he knows it Mr Bean is recording his own video which is uploaded for everyone to see. Things start to go crazy when people check out his funny video and his popularity takes off. But does Mr Bean enjoy being in the public eye and how long will his celebrity last?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 2 (15/52)
programme.desc: Mr Bean is obsessed by his favourite TV hero ‘Super Spy’ and is excited when his very own Super-Spy spy kit arrives in the post. While Mr Bean is pretending to be his favourite character and delighting in all his gadgets he spots some unusual goings on in the Bruisers’ house next door. Naturally Mr Bean assumes the worst and sets out to rectify the situation.

programme.title: Lamput - Season 3 (7/43)
programme.desc: It's Specs big night in the town with the lady of his dream. What could go wrong? The answer to that question might have do with the shapeshifting orange blob at the next table.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (32/39)
programme.desc: A lost little lamb appears at Maude's farm.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (33/39)
programme.desc: A Tom and Jerry take on the Johnny Appleseed story.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (34/39)
programme.desc: Tom is mistakenly placed in a shelter for homeless animals and forced to join the shelter's rock-n-roll while Jerry lives the life of riley back home.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (35/39)
programme.desc: The gang are determined to make Rick and Ginger change their mind about downsizing and moving to the big city by making it impossible to sell the house.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (36/39)
programme.desc: A lineage check determines that Spike is descended from British aristocracy.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (37/39)
programme.desc: Tom is tricked into believing he is invisible.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (38/39)
programme.desc: Tyke undergoes a personality change after watching to many cop shows on TV.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (39/39)
programme.desc: Quacker's cousin, and penguin named Tux, makes life miserable for Tom and Jerry when he insists on trying to devour the fish in Rick's new aquarium.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (1/39)
programme.desc: Papa tells his fractured version of the Jack and the Beanstalk story to the Bavarian mouse trio.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (2/39)
programme.desc: The gang get more than they bargained for when they try to shoo away a seemingly docile spider.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (3/39)
programme.desc: When Rick and Ginger forget Tom's birthday, the tomcat moves in with the one person who appreciates him -- the local Zoo's gorilla, Cuddles.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 2 (13/78)
programme.desc: After believing that Jerry has been eaten by a hungry bear cub, Tom must avoid the mama bear's wrath as he tries to retrieve his pal. Meanwhile, oblivious to Tom's plight, Jerry's enjoying the perks of circus life.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 5 (4/39)
programme.desc: To Tom and Jerry's delight Ginger's new no junk food in the house diet causes Rick to sleep walk every night to the local fast food joint.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (11/78)
programme.desc: Annoyed by a noisy high-speed chase between the Lemmings and a raccoon, Grizzy abruptly stops the game. The players fall into empty space and land in a clearing. The impact of their crash-landing cracks a black and white tile representing Yin and Yang and a strange light pours over the raccoon. Depending on his mood, the color of his fur changes, and his excitement or calm become contagious to all those around him!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (12/78)
programme.desc: On the way back from a fishing outing, Grizzy unwittingly brings back an electrode that controls a robot. Once activated, the gadget puts itself in the service of the bear, satisfying his each and every need. The envious Lemmings plot to take possession of this new metallic ally. They manage to evict the bear, who does not intend to take this lying down… especially when he discovers a pair of robotic arms hidden in a module that fell out of the robot!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (3/78)
programme.desc: After a game that ends abruptly, the Lemmings fall onto the roof of a temple where they discover drawings of Tai Chi movements. When carried out, the exercises generate a ball of energy! The Lemmings test out the sequence of movements on… Grizzy, until he is evicted from the cabin and falls onto the temple in turn. His fall unveils a new sequence of movements on a fresco that could create an even stronger energy flow!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (13/78)
programme.desc: At nightfall, just as Grizzy starts to doze off, a racket comes from outside the cabin: the Lemmings are sliding along the Great Wall in a crate, propelled by firework rockets. Cleverly avoiding the bear's strategies to stop them, the Lemmings accidentally set off a mechanism in a tower. A secret room filled with cannons and catapults opens, just waiting to be used by the powder monkey apprentices…

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (14/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings fight over the last jar of Yummy chocolate spread in the cabin and it ends up sinking in the lagoon. The bear makes a diving suit from various home facilities, while the Lemmings share a diving tank to put a wrench in their adversary's flippers! But the local wildlife comes to meet them…

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (15/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy wakes up after a nap, starving, but the last jar of Yummy chocolate spread is empty. The cupboards are barren, except for a package of chocolate powder. Grizzy has the idea of mixing it with coconut milk. It's absolutely delicious! But the Lemmings, who are every bit as gluttonous, want their share of the choco-coco drink!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (32/78)
programme.desc: A gust of wind sweeps away the flower that Grizzy's adored she-bear wears in her hair. Grizzy sees this as a golden opportunity to dazzle her by bringing it back. But the Lemmings, who are riding on the back of a bucking caribou, realize that the flower makes their mount sneeze, which only makes the game ten times more fun!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (33/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy finds two identical vases that are actually communicating vessels in a Native American Indian chest. If he sticks his hand in one, it comes out the other, between them. This should satisfy Grizzy's natural lazy streak, regardless of the distance unless the Lemmings realize the incredible games they could play with the magic vases.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (34/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy finds a vintage stopwatch in the garage which lets you wind back the minute that has just passed by and it can even stop time and movement in one's surroundings. This will give him a sure advantage over the Lemmings, provided of course they don't get their hands on it.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (35/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy is disturbed in the middle of his TV snack by a strange flow of incongruous objects that have been transformed into hot-air balloons. When he sees the Lemmings onboard these curious zeppelins, Grizzy understands that he will quickly have to confiscate their helium tank and balloons if he wants to relax in front of the TV.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (36/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers with great delight that the ranger has purchased a brand new multifunction Stressless recliner. But even an armchair designed for well-being - the ultimate in relaxation - can used for other purposes by the Lemmings, who transform it into a fearsome multi-game chair.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (37/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings play kite-surf with a homemade kite. Grizzy notices that the she-bear he's in love with watches the kite perform arabesques in the sky with admiration. He decides to make a kite that is far more sophisticated than the Lemmings kite.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (38/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy snatches the last jar of chocolate spread out from under the noses of the Lemmings. In exchange, he offers them the toy stuck inside the lid: a mini-flute. When the Lemmings blow into the flute, the shrill notes that come out paralyze anyone whose ears aren't plugged for several seconds. They decide to play a tune for Grizzy in order to recover their share of chocolate spread.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (11/52)
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is shocked when Teddy receives a birthday card from Bean’s girlfriend, Irma Gobb. The bear’s Birthday had completely slipped his mind. And what do you get for the teddy that has everything? A morning in a toy shop, burgers for lunch and a slap up tea party, of course. (But only if you can afford it.)

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (12/52)
programme.desc: Mr. Bean’s landlady is hopping mad on finding molehills on her lovely croquet lawn. Bean looks to get hammered if he does not rid the old lady of the cuddly little half-blind culprit. He fails dismally with his eccentric mole extermination methods and ends up simply taking the pesky rodent for a ride.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (13/52)
programme.desc: Mr. Bean’s tranquillity is shattered by deafening roadworks outside his bedroom window. Threats, sabotage and subterfuge all fail to quell the cacophony until Bean has the ingenious idea of feeding the workmen into peaceful submission. But the silence ends with a bang!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (14/52)
programme.desc: Mr. Bean likes nothing more than to relax on his sofa with a good meal and his favourite telly programme. Unfortunately, a painful explosion of springs under his bottom puts an end to that. He sets about buying another one… but, alas, sofas are expensive items. TV dinners may well be a thing of the past for Mr Bean.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (15/52)
programme.desc: In a dark and cobwebby corner of his attic, Mr. Bean finds a treasure map. The hunt is on! But tricky clues lead Bean up the chimney, round the bend, down the garden path, up the blinking wall and nearly all the way to Australia.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (16/52)
programme.desc: After a regrettable episode involving his landlady sleepwalking into his room, Mr. Bean suddenly finds himself out on his ear with nowhere to live. Near to tears, he yearns for the cosy familiarity of his old home. A scarecrow and a pair of false teeth come to his rescue.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (17/52)
programme.desc: An old photo album causes Bean to reminisce about his lovely summers at scout camp as a boy, and sets him planning a night under the stars with Teddy. Purchasing a tent becomes a tricky problem – but nothing will stop him having a good time, even if he has to get the garden shed over the roof of his house.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (18/52)
programme.desc: When his model aeroplane is blown out of the sky by that of a rival kid, Mr. Bean sets his sights on revenge. Next day, his newly constructed fighter plane, almost ready for take-off, sadly lacks a vital part – and the blinking model shop is shut! No matter. It’s chocks away with Teddy at the controls, fighting for airspace over London N10.

programme.title: Lamput - Season 3 (37/43)
programme.desc: Pursuing Lamput is a dastardly career, but there's a right and a wrong way to go about it. Doc Specs cuts corners, showing up at the Lab with a fake Lamput made out of a jar of marmalade and a couple ping pong balls - a Jamposter! Specs relishes his new role as hero of the day, but his best friend Skinny smells a rat. As does Lamput, who is patently NOT captured. Not to mention a battalion of ants who don't care at all about Spec's professional fortunes. Spec's plan has a serious use-by date. Lucky Skinny can forgive. As a friend, he's the real deal.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (25/78)
programme.desc: A helicopter takes off from the beach, leaving behind installations for a TV game, namely lots of food supplies – which are locked up. To access the keys and the food, participants must win team tests under the surveillance of a drone. The Lemmings are the yellow team. The red team is comprised of Grizzy, an oar, and a flabbergasted crab!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (26/78)
programme.desc: While trying to avoid the Lemmings' outboard speedboat, Grizzy punctures his air mattress and is propelled into a hidden grotto where he finds a conch decorated with Maori symbols that can control whales. Grizzy returns, proudly straddling his cetacean and chases the Lemmings from his peaceful spot. But the Lemmings' imagination is equal to the size of this potential new playmate!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (27/78)
programme.desc: While arguing over a jar of Yummy, Grizzy and the Lemmings happen upon a polar bear cub who is crying. When the little bear sees them, he wails even louder. Annoyed by his sobs, Grizzy and the rodents try to pacify him, but nothing works. After feeding and changing him, the baby finally falls asleep. How can they pick up their Yummy battle without waking the cub?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (28/78)
programme.desc: A meteorite falls not far from the cabin. While the Lemmings are sledding outside on a metal pot lid, their sled is abruptly drawn to the extraterrestrial boulder. In seventh heaven, the rodents start over again, this time using the TV satellite dish. But Grizzy, determined to get the dish back at any cost, must confront the magnetism of the meteorite and the fury of the Lemmings, for the rodents are set on playing.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (29/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings have set up a long line of dominos in the cabin that ends with several giant ice blocks and a rocket outside. Weary of not finding the peace and calm he loves so dearly, Grizzy sabotages the game. The rocket hits an ice block and blows up the cabin. Grizzy gets his hands on a machine that can sculpt ice. The bear dreams of an igloo, but the Lemmings have other projects.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (30/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings find an ice block outside the log cabin that holds a frozen prehistoric animal: a saber-toothed racoon. Softened, the Lemmings free the creature and try to tame it like a kitten. But the raccoon is like a whirlwind. Grizzy wakes up and discovers the cabin topsy-turvy and flies into a rage. But when the bear tries to kick the rodents out, the wild raccoon challenges him.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (31/78)
programme.desc: By chance, Grizzy and the Lemmings discover a container filled with metal survival food flasks. Primarily filled with vegetables, they do not find favor with the bear, who is more interested in the hi-tech equipment at the rear of the container. Behind his back, the Lemmings find a flask of Yummy and skedaddle with it. But how will they escape Grizzy equipped with his sophisticated gear?

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (41/52)
programme.desc: Lewis has been playing water fights with Alice for too long and now he’s come down with a bout of blue-bung-itis. It’s a kind of cold which, besides causing nasal congestion, also makes one teleport in a very contagious blue cloud! Alice realizes it’s not going to be easy treating everyone while Lewis is sick with blue-bung-itis!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (42/52)
programme.desc: Alice’s kitten, Echo, surreptitiously follows his owner into Wonderland. Worse still, soon after arriving, the little feline drinks a power drink meant for the Queen and becomes endowed with supernatural strength. Lewis is categorical: Echo is the monster their ancestors talked about in the Big Book – the one that is destined to destroy Wonderland! Alice and Lewis must come up with a solution fast, before Echo wrecks everything! But how are they going to catch him?...

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (43/52)
programme.desc: Alice turns up in Wonderland with a plastic toy magic wand. So imagine her surprise when she finds out that, in this parallel location, it actually works like a real-life magic wand! Lewis is circumspect. He warns her: magic can be dangerous when you don’t know what you’re doing! Alice promises she’ll be careful – she’ll only use it to help people. But before long, our little friend realizes Lewis was right, especially when Charlie snags her wand and runs off with it, using it randomly! Alice must find a way to clean up her mistakes and those of Charlie, and get everything back the way it was.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (44/52)
programme.desc: Lewis needs to give the Queen a gift, so Alice offers to help by suggesting they paint a rock. But, just as they are getting started, a weird bird turns up on the scene, claiming the "rock" is actually the bird's egg! However, Lewis knows the bird in question - It's Dodson the Dodo; not only is he a wacky individual, he's also very prone to fibbing! There's no way the rabbit is going to let him keep the rock! But Dodson isn't letting go and, next thing you know, he accidentally makes the egg fall. Quick! It must be retrieved!

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (57/78)
programme.desc: It's cold and grey outside. Mike invites Iris over to warm up over a hot chocolate. The raccoons sneak into the house and damage the Mikkelsen's home Automation Temperature regulator in the process. Now the house is randomly flipping between blistering hot to freezing cold. Mike has to face danger, overcome challenges, and battle the elements in order to boot the raccoons out of the house.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (58/78)
programme.desc: The raccoons steal Iris's favorite toy but accidentally drop it on the terrace during their escape. Mike picks it up while cleaning, thinking it's Fluffys. Iris notices and thinks Mike stole it. She stomps over to the house to get it back, but Fluffy has already made off with it. By the time Mike has figured it all out, the raccoons have stolen it back again. Mike needs to get the toy back if he wants Iris to ever forgive him.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (59/78)
programme.desc: Mike's plans to hang out with Iris are cruelly dashed when he trots out onto the patio to find her playing with a hunky other dog. Mike is crushed. This means war! The boys begin a merciless fight for Iris's affection while she watches horrified. But when the raccoons break into the house armed with an air horn, the two romantic rivals have to team up to overcome their differences to eject the raccoons from the house.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (60/78)
programme.desc: It's April Fool's Day. Mike has invited Iris over for a romantic dinner but instead of romance, Iris is more interested in pranking Mike. Mike does his best to take it in his stride and keep the evening on track. Meanwhile, the raccoons have their sights set on the dinner. Mike and Iris team up to create the ultimate prank obstacle course around the house and the joke is on the raccoons.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (61/78)
programme.desc: A cute white cat turns up on the Mikkelsen's patio. Everyone thinks it's super-duper adorable, especially Iris. It looks like Fluffy has found a new friend, but for some reason Fluffy seems to be finding himself in increasingly life-threatening situations. Thankfully, Mike is on top of it and saves Fluffy's life more than once. But curiously, that cute new kitty is always around. Is he trying to replace the family's cat and become the new favorite?

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (62/78)
programme.desc: It's Mike's birthday and he's excited to be spending the day with Iris. But instead of a private party, Iris has invited the entire neighbourhood. As soon as the raccoons learn there's a party, they resolve to crash it and steal Mike's birthday cake and presents. Mike has his work cut out for him. He has to get rid of raccoons and throw a great birthday party.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (63/78)
programme.desc: When Tom suggests to his mom that Mike could be a show dog, she bursts out laughing. Mike is hurt and sets out to prove that he's show dog material. Mike asks the classiest dog he knows for help and Iris agrees to put Mike through his paces. She creates an obstacle course for Mike to overcome and hone his show dog skills. But Mike's training is interrupted by the raccoons trying to steal from the house.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (55/78)
programme.desc: An old metal box found by chance in a recess of a cliff brings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (56/78)
programme.desc: How can one peacefully watch a documentary on salmon fish, nice and comfy on the sofa, when the Lemmings are playing chemistry novices with a fun experiment box? By confiscating their equipment? Beware of side effects.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (57/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy's TV remote control is stolen by a partridge who collects high-tech objects in his nest perched high up in a tree. This is a case of absolute urgency! Grizzy has no other choice but to requisition the Lemmings propulsion game to recover his possession. But try and make a Lemming understand that!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (58/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy has got it into his head to offer a butterfly to the she-bear he's in love with. But the Lemmings fight with him over the rare specimens he's spotted, for they want to play helicopter. The butterfly hunt is on!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (59/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings have discovered an addictive new game based on the astonishing bouncing properties of the ranger's new running shoes. Grizzy, who is trying to relax, confiscates the shoes and soon realizes they are far more comfortable than his thongs.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (68/78)
programme.desc: While looking for the TV remote-control device, Grizzy happens onto a box that can localize a bunch of keys thanks to its key ring, which is equipped with a tracker. Grizzy decides to stick the spy device under a jar of chocolate spread, just in case the Lemmings should decide to carry it off.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (60/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy babysits for the she-bear he has a crush on, who has entrusted him with the care of her cub. There's no question of Grizzy tripping up, for he has no intention of taking any risks! But he hadn't reckoned on the Lemmings. Captivated by the baby's burps after meals, they dream of making it drink gallons of soda pop to make it do the "Big One."

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (35/78)
programme.desc: Mike has the perfect gift idea for Iris, flowers! The only snag is that Mike discovers he's horribly allergic and the raccoons use Mike's sneezing fits as an opportunity to rob the house. He's going to need all his ingenuity and resolve "and an extra-large box of tissues" to defeat the raccoons and give the flowers to Iris.

programme.title: Španělská princezna (6)
programme.desc: Osmidílné historické drama Španělská princezna pojednává o Kateřině Aragonské, krásné mladé španělské princezně, které je již od dětství zaslíben anglický trůn. Přijíždí proto do pošmourné, deštěm bičované Anglie se svým pompézním a rozmanitým královským dvorem včetně dvorní dámy Liny, pocházející ze subsaharské Afriky. Stane se princeznou z Walesu, ale po náhlé smrti prince Artura, za něhož se provdala, vše nasvědčuje tomu, že je pro ni trůn navždy ztracen. Kateřina však tvrdí, že její manželství nikdy nebylo naplněno, takže je stále pannou. Začne se zajímat o nového dědice, charismatického a umíněného prince Jindřicha, který bude jednoho dne vládnout jako král Jindřich VIII.

programme.title: Případy detektiva Murdocha XI (11/19)
programme.desc: Seriál vychází z detektivních románů Maureen Jenningsové, které čtenářům představily Williama Murdocha, člena torontské policejní stanice, muže, obdařeného zvláštním druhem přímo vizionářské intuice, a především člověka, jenž na hony předběhl svou dobu. Neboť Murdoch si na rozdíl od mnoha svých policejních kolegů i nadřízených moc dobře uvědomuje význam a váhu všech vědeckých objevů, jimiž konec devatenáctého století doslova překypuje. Objevů, jejichž použití v kriminalistice najednou otevírá netušené možnosti detektivní práce, vyšetřovacích metod, jejichž použitím lze nad jakoukoliv pochybnost usvědčit pachatele nejrůznějších - i těch nejzávažnějších trestných činů. S obrovskou chutí se tak vrhá do všech dobrodružství, které před něj kriminalistika a jednotlivé případy staví. Ani Murdoch by ve světě, nepříliš přejícím novotám a pokroku, samozřejmě nemohl pracovat zcela sám. Naštěstí našel víc než schopnou pomocnici v doktorce Ogdenové, patoložce, ochotné vyzkoušet každý, byť na první pohled sebebláznivější Murdochův nápad. (Takovým je například pokus o rekonstrukci podoby člověka z jeho lebky.) A nezapomínejme ani na konstábla Crabtreeho, který se ve svém moderně uvažujícím šéfovi vidí, jednou by chtěl být jako on a zatím mu alespoň spolehlivě sekunduje.Seriál se v Kanadě stal doslova diváckým hitem a s úspěchem je sledován i v řadě dalších zemích. Velkou zásluhu na přitažlivosti má představitel hlavní role, sympatický Yannick Bisson, jenž zatím u nás není příliš znám.

programme.title: Případy detektiva Murdocha XI (12/19)
programme.desc: Seriál vychází z detektivních románů Maureen Jenningsové, které čtenářům představily Williama Murdocha, člena torontské policejní stanice, muže, obdařeného zvláštním druhem přímo vizionářské intuice, a především člověka, jenž na hony předběhl svou dobu. programme.title: Slečna Marplová III (2/4)
programme.desc: Slečna Marplová je vedle Hercula Poirota druhou nejznámější postavou nekorunované královny detektivek Agathy Christie a hrdinkou dvanácti jejích knih. Čtenářům se představila už v roce 1930 v románu, nazvaném Vražda na faře , a pak už v rychlém sledu následovaly příběhy další. Milá stará dáma se zálibou v zahradničení a sousedských klípcích, s všudypřítomnou velkou taškou plnou pletení a jiných nezbytností, je na první pohled zosobněním anglické staré panny poloviny minulého století. Běda však tomu, kdo se nechá zmýlit jejím nenápadným vzezřením! Kdo si neuvědomí, že se za ním skrývá bystrý mozek, pro který je řešení záhad všeho druhu nejen nejoblíbenějším koníčkem, ale přímo posedlostí. Dlužno říci, že tímto mírně přezíravým postojem vůči ní trpí zkraje zejména všichni inspektoři, policejní komisaři a vůbec vyšetřovatelé všeho druhu, kteří nelibě nesou, že se jim tahle neodbytná babka plete do práce. Každý z nich si ovšem dříve nebo později musí uvědomit, že na slečnu Marplovou prostě nemá. Protože to, k čemu se oni dlouze, složitě a „zdeúředně“ konečně doberou, to už ona dávno svým vlídným přístupem, pochopením pro lidské slabosti i znalostí prostředí odhalila a je zase o krůček před nimi… Tak jako všechny detektivní romány Agathy Christie jsou i příběhy slečny Marplové vděčnou a neustále znovu využívanou látkou pro filmové i televizní tvůrce. V roli tohoto „detektiva v sukních“ se již vystřídalo více hereček. V paměti českých diváků nepochybně dodnes zůstává např. Margaret Rutherfordová z filmu To je vražda, řekla, natočeného podle románu Vlak z Paddingtonu , Angela Lansburyová, která byla slečnou Marplovou v Rozbitém zrcadle, či Joan Hicksonová, která řadu jejích případů natočila pro BBC. (Na naší obrazovce jsme z nich před lety viděli Ohlášenou vraždu a Zapomenutou vraždu…) ... Tvůrci nejnovějšího zpracování této dnes již klasické látky vsadili na Geraldinu McEwanovou, herečku, která dokáže ve svém projevu spojit sladkou vlídnost s tvrdostí švédské oceli. (Jak to právě v poslední době předvedla v roli sestry Bridget v působivém snímku Petera Mullana Padlé ženy). Geraldine, (která se této role ujala ve svých dvaasedmdesáti letech) je podle tvůrců slečnou Marplovou nového milénia, neboť se společně s nimi pokouší o nový, moderní přístup k této postavě. Umožňují jí to i některé nové prvky, k nimž autoři sáhli (byť samozřejmě velmi pietně zachovávají ducha a charakter, jimiž svou postavu obdařila Agatha Christie). Jedním z nich je třeba i to, že na rozdíl od všech minulých pojetí má zde Jane Marplová nejen svou přítomnost, ale i minulost. Geraldine sama je pochopitelně svým nejnovějším úkolem nadšena, což lze dedukovat i z jejího stručného vyznání: „Mám pocit, že mi rolí slečny Marplové byl svěřen svého druhu národní poklad, který mimořádně obdivuji a hodlám důsledně chránit…“

programme.title: Případy detektiva Murdocha XI (13/19)
programme.desc: Seriál vychází z detektivních románů Maureen Jenningsové, které čtenářům představily Williama Murdocha, člena torontské policejní stanice, muže, obdařeného zvláštním druhem přímo vizionářské intuice, a především člověka, jenž na hony předběhl svou dobu. Velkou zásluhu na přitažlivosti má představitel hlavní role, sympatický Yannick Bisson, jenž zatím u nás není příliš znám.

programme.title: Grantchester III (4)
programme.desc: Detektivní seriál z produkce britské ITV vznikl podle povídek anglického spisovatele, filmového dokumentaristy, televizního producenta a dramatika Jamese Runcieho. Jeho hrdinou je mladý reverend anglikánské církve Sidney Chambers z malebného Grantchesteru, nacházejícího se pár mil od univerzitního města Cambridge. Děj je zasazen do první poloviny 50. let. Mladý, poněkud nekonvenční vikář se slabostí pro jazz a whiskey, bojoval ve druhé světové válce, odkud si odnesl nepěkné vzpomínky. Zvídavý mladý muž se shodou okolností pustí do vyšetřování zločinu a spojí síly s místním policejním detektivem Geordiem Keatingem. Oba muži si přes počáteční nedůvěru padnou do noty a při vyšetřování se vzájemně doplňují. Hlavní roli reverenda Chamberse v seriálu ztvárnil James Norton, vycházející hvězda britské televizní i filmové tvorby (Šťastné údolí, Vojna a mír, Smrt přichází do Pemberley, McMafia), v roli inspektora Keatinga vystupuje méně známý, ale osvědčený, převážně televizní herec Robson Green. Dosud v letech 2014–2017 vznikly tři šestidílné řady, v letošním roce stanice ITV potvrdila, že se hrdinové brzy vrátí v řadě čtvrté.

programme.title: Vražedné záhady slečny Fisherové (8)
programme.desc: Naše dáma vyšetřuje zločin v opuštěných uličkách a jazzových klubech Melbourne na konci 20. let. S pistolí s perleťovou rukojetí a ostrovtipem bojuje proti bezpráví.

programme.title: Endeavour III (2/4)
programme.desc: Jeden z nejoblíbenějších britských detektivů mladý Endeavour Morse a jeho první skutečný policejní případ. Ač zelenáč, je vždy o krok napřed před svými úmornými kolegy, což mu přináší problém s autoritami, ne vždy mu jde vyšetřování podle představ, ale jinak je to přirozený detektivní talent. S prvním půllitrem, láskou k opeře a křížovkám se pouští do objasnění zmizení patnáctileté studentky.

programme.title: Inspektor George Gently V (4)
programme.desc: Inspektor George Gently je detektiv ze staré školy, který se snaží vypořádat s novou dobou a novými způsoby vyšetřování. Pro dopadení pachatele je schopný udělat cokoliv a ví, že hranice mezi policistou a zločincem dokáže být někdy velmi tenká. S pomocí detektiva seržanta Johna Bacchuse tráví své dny tím, že staví před soud členy zločineckého podsvětí, kteří mají tu smůlu, že byl k jejich případům přidělen neohrožený vyšetřovatel.

programme.title: Slečna Marplová III (3/4)
programme.desc: Slečna Marplová je vedle Hercula Poirota druhou nejznámější postavou nekorunované královny detektivek Agathy Christie a hrdinkou dvanácti jejích knih. Čtenářům se představila už v roce 1930 v románu, nazvaném Vražda na faře , a pak už v rychlém sledu následovaly příběhy další. Milá stará dáma se zálibou v zahradničení a sousedských klípcích, s všudypřítomnou velkou taškou plnou pletení a jiných nezbytností, je na první pohled zosobněním anglické staré panny poloviny minulého století. Běda však tomu, kdo se nechá zmýlit jejím nenápadným vzezřením! Kdo si neuvědomí, že se za ním skrývá bystrý mozek, pro který je řešení záhad všeho druhu nejen nejoblíbenějším koníčkem, ale přímo posedlostí. Dlužno říci, že tímto mírně přezíravým postojem vůči ní trpí zkraje zejména všichni inspektoři, policejní komisaři a vůbec vyšetřovatelé všeho druhu, kteří nelibě nesou, že se jim tahle neodbytná babka plete do práce. Každý z nich si ovšem dříve nebo později musí uvědomit, že na slečnu Marplovou prostě nemá. Protože to, k čemu se oni dlouze, složitě a „zdeúředně“ konečně doberou, to už ona dávno svým vlídným přístupem, pochopením pro lidské slabosti i znalostí prostředí odhalila a je zase o krůček před nimi… Tak jako všechny detektivní romány Agathy Christie jsou i příběhy slečny Marplové vděčnou a neustále znovu využívanou látkou pro filmové i televizní tvůrce. V roli tohoto „detektiva v sukních“ se již vystřídalo více hereček. V paměti českých diváků nepochybně dodnes zůstává např. Margaret Rutherfordová z filmu To je vražda, řekla, natočeného podle románu Vlak z Paddingtonu , Angela Lansburyová, která byla slečnou Marplovou v Rozbitém zrcadle, či Joan Hicksonová, která řadu jejích případů natočila pro BBC. (Na naší obrazovce jsme z nich před lety viděli Ohlášenou vraždu a Zapomenutou vraždu…) ... Tvůrci nejnovějšího zpracování této dnes již klasické látky vsadili na Geraldinu McEwanovou, herečku, která dokáže ve svém projevu spojit sladkou vlídnost s tvrdostí švédské oceli. (Jak to právě v poslední době předvedla v roli sestry Bridget v působivém snímku Petera Mullana Padlé ženy). Geraldine, (která se této role ujala ve svých dvaasedmdesáti letech) je podle tvůrců slečnou Marplovou nového milénia, neboť se společně s nimi pokouší o nový, moderní přístup k této postavě. Umožňují jí to i některé nové prvky, k nimž autoři sáhli (byť samozřejmě velmi pietně zachovávají ducha a charakter, jimiž svou postavu obdařila Agatha Christie). Jedním z nich je třeba i to, že na rozdíl od všech minulých pojetí má zde Jane Marplová nejen svou přítomnost, ale i minulost. Geraldine sama je pochopitelně svým nejnovějším úkolem nadšena, což lze dedukovat i z jejího stručného vyznání: „Mám pocit, že mi rolí slečny Marplové byl svěřen svého druhu národní poklad, který mimořádně obdivuji a hodlám důsledně chránit…“

programme.title: Případy detektiva Murdocha XI (13/19)
programme.desc: Seriál vychází z detektivních románů Maureen Jenningsové, které čtenářům představily Williama Murdocha, člena torontské policejní stanice, muže, obdařeného zvláštním druhem přímo vizionářské intuice, a především člověka, jenž na hony předběhl svou dobu. Neboť Murdoch si na rozdíl od mnoha svých policejních kolegů i nadřízených moc dobře uvědomuje význam a váhu všech vědeckých objevů, jimiž konec devatenáctého století doslova překypuje. Objevů, jejichž použití v kriminalistice najednou otevírá netušené možnosti detektivní práce, vyšetřovacích metod, jejichž použitím lze nad jakoukoliv pochybnost usvědčit pachatele nejrůznějších - i těch nejzávažnějších trestných činů. S obrovskou chutí se tak vrhá do všech dobrodružství, které před něj kriminalistika a jednotlivé případy staví. Ani Murdoch by ve světě, nepříliš přejícím novotám a pokroku, samozřejmě nemohl pracovat zcela sám. Naštěstí našel víc než schopnou pomocnici v doktorce Ogdenové, patoložce, ochotné vyzkoušet každý, byť na první pohled sebebláznivější Murdochův nápad. (Takovým je například pokus o rekonstrukci podoby člověka z jeho lebky.) A nezapomínejme ani na konstábla Crabtreeho, který se ve svém moderně uvažujícím šéfovi vidí, jednou by chtěl být jako on a zatím mu alespoň spolehlivě sekunduje.Seriál se v Kanadě stal doslova diváckým hitem a s úspěchem je sledován i v řadě dalších zemích. Velkou zásluhu na přitažlivosti má představitel hlavní role, sympatický Yannick Bisson, jenž zatím u nás není příliš znám.

programme.title: Vraždy pro slečnu Fisherovou (6)
programme.desc: Peregrine Fisherová se dozvídá o smrti své tety Phryne. Nikdy ji neviděla, ale zdědila po ní dům, auto a nesporně také talent řešit záhady. Jakmile přijede, aby si převzala své dědictví, stane se zločin, který bude pro Peregrine velkou výzvou...

programme.title: Grantchester (6/6)
programme.desc: Detektivní seriál z produkce britské ITV vznikl podle povídek anglického spisovatele, filmového dokumentaristy, televizního producenta a dramatika Jamese Runcieho. programme.title: Policajt (3/10)
programme.desc: V roce 1864 se Kevin Corcoran vrací z občanské války. V New Yorku, městě plném korupce, třídních konfliktů, rasového napětí a násilí je jmenován policejním detektivem. Corcoran se nezastaví před ničím, aby pohnal zločince před soud.Poutavý kriminální seriál, odehrávající se v New Yorku šedesátých let 19. století. Kevin Corcoran (Tom Weston-Jones), Američan irského původu a bývalý boxer, se vrací z občanské války. Jeho žena se pohřešuje a dcera je mrtvá. Kevin nastupuje jako policista a hlídkuje v ulicích nechvalně známé newyorské čtvrti Five Points a zároveň se usilovně snaží zjistit pravdu o tom, co se stalo jeho rodině. Pomáhají mu v tom kamarádi z války: vzdorovitý syn bohatého průmyslníka a nadaný afroamerický lékař. Tito tři muži sdílejí tajemství z války, jež spojuje jejich životy navždy.

programme.title: Případy detektiva Murdocha XI (13/19)
programme.desc: Seriál vychází z detektivních románů Maureen Jenningsové, které čtenářům představily Williama Murdocha, člena torontské policejní stanice, muže, obdařeného zvláštním druhem přímo vizionářské intuice, a především člověka, jenž na hony předběhl svou dobu. Neboť Murdoch si na rozdíl od mnoha svých policejních kolegů i nadřízených moc dobře uvědomuje význam a váhu všech vědeckých objevů, jimiž konec devatenáctého století doslova překypuje. Objevů, jejichž použití v kriminalistice najednou otevírá netušené možnosti detektivní práce, vyšetřovacích metod, jejichž použitím lze nad jakoukoliv pochybnost usvědčit pachatele nejrůznějších - i těch nejzávažnějších trestných činů. S obrovskou chutí se tak vrhá do všech dobrodružství, které před něj kriminalistika a jednotlivé případy staví. Ani Murdoch by ve světě, nepříliš přejícím novotám a pokroku, samozřejmě nemohl pracovat zcela sám. Naštěstí našel víc než schopnou pomocnici v doktorce Ogdenové, patoložce, ochotné vyzkoušet každý, byť na první pohled sebebláznivější Murdochův nápad. (Takovým je například pokus o rekonstrukci podoby člověka z jeho lebky.) A nezapomínejme ani na konstábla Crabtreeho, který se ve svém moderně uvažujícím šéfovi vidí, jednou by chtěl být jako on a zatím mu alespoň spolehlivě sekunduje.Seriál se v Kanadě stal doslova diváckým hitem a s úspěchem je sledován i v řadě dalších zemích. Velkou zásluhu na přitažlivosti má představitel hlavní role, sympatický Yannick Bisson, jenž zatím u nás není příliš znám.

programme.title: Vraždy pro slečnu Fisherovou (6)
programme.desc: Peregrine Fisherová se dozvídá o smrti své tety Phryne. Nikdy ji neviděla, ale zdědila po ní dům, auto a nesporně také talent řešit záhady. Jakmile přijede, aby si převzala své dědictví, stane se zločin, který bude pro Peregrine velkou výzvou...

programme.title: Grantchester (6/6)
programme.desc: Detektivní seriál z produkce britské ITV vznikl podle povídek anglického spisovatele, filmového dokumentaristy, televizního producenta a dramatika Jamese Runcieho. Jeho hrdinou je mladý reverend anglikánské církve Sidney Chambers z malebného Grantchesteru, nacházejícího se pár mil od univerzitního města Cambridge. Děj je zasazen do první poloviny 50. let. Mladý, poněkud nekonvenční vikář se slabostí pro jazz a whiskey, bojoval ve druhé světové válce, odkud si odnesl nepěkné vzpomínky. Zvídavý mladý muž se shodou okolností pustí do vyšetřování zločinu a spojí síly s místním policejním detektivem Geordiem Keatingem. Oba muži si přes počáteční nedůvěru padnou do noty a při vyšetřování se vzájemně doplňují. Hlavní roli reverenda Chamberse v seriálu ztvárnil James Norton, vycházející hvězda britské televizní i filmové tvorby (Šťastné údolí, Vojna a mír, Smrt přichází do Pemberley, McMafia), v roli inspektora Keatinga vystupuje méně známý, ale osvědčený, převážně televizní herec Robson Green. Dosud v letech 2014–2017 vznikly tři šestidílné řady, v letošním roce stanice ITV potvrdila, že se hrdinové brzy vrátí v řadě čtvrté.
